Araucanía: 
According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather warnings are in force for the Araucanía Region. 

Alert Forecast Start End
Alert AA65-4 Moderate to heavy rainfall with high zero isotherm for the mountain range. 29/07 30/07
Notice A288-1 Normal to moderate wind for the coastal area of the region 29/07 30/07
Notice A280-5 Normal to moderate rainfall with high isotherm in valley, pre-mountain and mountain areas. 29/07 30/07
Notice A290-2 Probable thunderstorms with a probability of heavy rainfall in a short period of time on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and pre-mountain range. 31/07 31/07
Notice A290-8 Probable thunderstorms with a probability of heavy rainfall in a short period of time on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and pre-mountain range. 01/08 01/08

Likewise, according to the DMC's Meteorological Hazard Report, the amounts of precipitation (mm/cm), wind (km/h) and isotherm 0°C (m.a.s.l.) forecast for the next few days in the region, are as follows:

Zone 01 August 02 August 03
PrecipitationWindPrecipitationWind PrecipitationWind
Littoral 20 - 45 - 10 - 20 - - -
Coastal mountain range 20 – 40
≤ 3 cm		 25 - 40
Streaks 50		 10 - 25
≤ 5 cm		 - ≤ 3 -
Longitudinal valley 5 - 15 - 10 - 20 - - -
Foothills 15 - 30
≤ 3 cm		 - 5 - 15
≤ 3 cm		 - - -
Mountain range 15 – 30 cm - 13 – 30 cm 40 - 60 1 - 5 cm -
Isothermal 0°C 1.700 - 1.500 1.500 - 1.000 1.000 - 1.400

It should be noted that the rainfall amounts in the table above include the period between 09:00 hours on the indicated day and 09:00 hours the following day.

On the other hand, the Meteorological Service of the Chilean Navy maintains its Warning No. 30 for normal swells in force, until today, Friday, August 1 for the coasts of the region.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of La Araucanía, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since July 26 and until conditions warrant it.

Los Sauces: According to what was reported by the General Directorate of Water (DGA), through its online reporting system of the stations of the Fluviometric Network, it is indicated that the station "Río Rahue in Quebrada Culén" has increased its red alert threshold, which, if the flow continues to increase, could affect people and damage the commune's infrastructure.

In consideration of this background, which implies an increase in the risk associated with this variable, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED La Araucanía, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation, declares a Red Alert for the communes of Los Sauces and Angol due to overflow and cancels the Yellow Alert due to flooding. effective from today and until the conditions of the event warrant it.

Valparaiso:

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather warnings are in force for the Valparaíso Region:

Alert Forecast Start End
Alert AA73 Thunderstorms with a probability of heavy rainfall in a short period of time in the coastal and dry southern coastal sectors of the region. 01/08 01/08
Alert AA69 Moderate to strong wind in Easter Island Province 01/08 02/08
Notice A283-4 Normal to moderate wind in coastal sectors, coastal mountain range and mountain range of the region. 30/07 02/08
Notice A287-10 Normal to moderate rainfall in sectors of the foothills and pre-Andean valleys of the region. 01/08 02/08
Notice A291 Normal to moderate wind in Easter Island Province. 01/08 02/08
Notice A290-9 Probable thunderstorms with a probability of heavy rainfall in a short period of time, on the coast and coastal mountain range. 01/08 01/08

On the other hand, according to the information provided by the Navy Meteorological Center, Storm Surge Warnings No. 31 for normal swells are in force for Easter Island, in force until August 4; and Warning No. 30 for normal swells from the Corona Lighthouse to Arica and Juan Fernández Archipelago, in force until August 1.

Finally, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for the Danger of Mass Removals, issued today, indicates that the possibility of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides) is high on the coast and coastal mountain range. moderate in the foothills and pre-mountain valleys, and low in the mountain range.

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Valparaíso, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since July 29 and until conditions warrant it.

Los Lagos:

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), due to the weakening of the meteorological conditions that caused it, the following alert has been canceled for the Los Lagos Region:

Warning Prognosis
Notice A297 Probable snowfall in the valley, foothills, Chiloé and inland coast.

Finally, according to today's Meteorological Hazard Report and the current alert, the amounts of precipitation (mm) and isotherm 0°C (m.a.s.l.) forecast for the following days in the region are as follows:

Zone August 03 August 04 August 05
Littoral Less than 2   2-8
Coastal mountain range   10-20 2-8
Longitudinal valley 2-8
(≤2 a.m.)		 10-20 5-15
Foothills 2-5 cm morning 15-25 15-25
Mountain range 2-5 cm 5-10 5-15
Chiloé 2-8 10-20 2-8
Inland coastline 1-3 cm morning 10-20 10-20
Southern mountain range   10-20
Less than 2 cm		 5-15
Sub-Andean Patagonia   5-15 2-8
Isothermal 0°C
Puerto Montt to the north		 900-1300 1300-2400 2400-2200
Isotherm 0°C from Puerto Montt to the south 570-1000-250 250-1000 1900-2200-1800

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED modifies the Regional Preventive Early Warning variable for rainfall, which has been in force since July 21 and until conditions warrant it.

The modification of this alert is constituted as a state of reinforcement of surveillance, through the precise and rigorous monitoring of risk conditions and the respective vulnerabilities associated with the threat, coordinating and activating the National System for Disaster Prevention and Response (SINAPRED) in order to act in a timely manner in the event of emergency situations.

Ñuble:

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather warnings are in force for the Ñuble Region:

Alert Forecast Start End
Alert AA65-7 Moderate to heavy rainfall with high zero isotherm on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley, pre-mountain range and mountain range. 30-07 30-07
Notice A283-3 Normal to moderate wind on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley, pre-mountain range and mountain range. 30-07 31-07
Notice A287-5 Normal to moderate rainfall on the coast, coastal mountain range and valley. 30-07 31-07

On the other hand, the Meteorological Service of the Chilean Navy maintains its Warning No. 30 for normal swells in force, between Thursday, July 31 and Friday, August 1 for the coasts of the region.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Ñuble, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since July 28, 2025.

 

Basic Sums:

 

Drinking Water Supply
Commune of Coelemu: rural drinking water service interrupted in the SSR Meipo affecting 80 customers.
Ránquil Commune: rural drinking water service interrupted in SSR San Ignacio de Palomares, affecting 223 customers.

 

Power supply
Antofagasta: 86 customers without supply
Atacama: 125 customers without supply
Coquimbo: 1107 customers without supply
Valparaíso: 4455 customers without supply
Metropolitan: 2587 customers without supply
O'Higgins: 286 customers without supply
Maule: 237 customers without supply
Ñuble: 57 customers without supply
Biobío: 1006 customers without supply
La Araucanía: 1241 customers without supply
Los Lagos: 270 customers without supply
Los Lagos: 333 customers without supply

Data

Housing 1 house destroyed.
1706 homes with minor damage.
10 homes with major damage.
786 homes with damage under evaluation.
Hostels Commune of Canela: Municipal Residence.
Mulchén: Blanco Encalada School.
Renaico: Contingency High School
Theodore Schmidt: Boarding school at the Nueva Alborada School.
Purranque: Cruise Headquarters

It should be noted that the rainfall amounts in the table above include the period between 09:00 hours on the indicated day and 09:00 hours the following day.

On the other hand, the Meteorological Service of the Chilean Navy maintains its Warning No. 30 for normal swells in force, between Thursday, July 31 and Friday, August 1 for the coasts of the region.

Finally, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through its Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, updated today, indicates that the possibility of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides) is moderate throughout the region.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Biobío, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since July 22 and until conditions warrant it.

Los Angeles

According to the technical information provided by the General Directorate of Water (DGA), in its hydrometric stations monitored online, it is indicated that the Estero Paillihue station on the Ex. Long. Sur, a commune of Los Angeles, has reached the yellow alert level.

Additionally, it is indicated that considering the historical behavior of the Paillihue Estuary on the Ex. Long route. South during previous weather events, could mean an increase in the risk associated with floods or consequent overflows.

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Biobío, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED cancels Red Alert due to overflow and declares Yellow Alert for the commune of Los Angeles due to flooding, effective as of today and until conditions warrant it.

Conception

According to the technical information provided by the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED Biobío, it is indicated that as a result of the overflow of the Andalién River in the commune of Concepción, the Santa Rita and former Chaimavida Toll sectors were evacuated, which was reinforced by SAE messaging at 1:50 p.m. and 1:52 p.m. today.

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Biobío, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED maintains the Red Alert for the commune of Concepción due to overflow, in force as of today and until conditions warrant it.

The Lakes

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather warnings are in force for the Los Lagos Region:

Metropolitan

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following meteorological alerts are in force for the Metropolitan Region:

Finally, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, issued yesterday, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides) is moderate in the coastal mountain range and pre-mountain range. and low in the valley and mountain range of the region.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Metropolitan Regional Presidential Delegation, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which remains in force from July 30 and until conditions warrant it.

Ñuble

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather warnings are in force for the Ñuble Region:

Alert Forecast Start End
Alert AA65-7 Moderate to heavy rainfall with high zero isotherm on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley, pre-mountain range and mountain range. 30/07 30/07

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Ñuble, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since July 28, 2025.

Province of Osorno

According to the technical information provided by the General Directorate of Water (DGA), in its hydrometric stations monitored online, it is indicated that the Rahue River stations formerly join Rio Negro, Río Negro in Chahuilco and Rahue River in Forrahue, located in the communes of Río Negro and Osorno, are on Yellow Technical Alert.

In consideration of this background, which implies an increase in the risk associated with this variable, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Yellow Alert for the Province of Osorno due to flooding, effective from today and until conditions warrant it.

Curarrehue

According to the technical information provided by the General Directorate of Water (DGA), in relation to the online monitoring of its hydrometric stations, it is indicated that the Rio Trancura station in Curarrehue, Curarrehue commune, has reached the blue alert threshold. with a downward trend in its flow, which means a decrease in the risk associated with this variable.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of La Araucanía, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED cancels the Yellow Alert for the commune of Curarrehue due to the threat of overflow, which remained in force since July 30, 2025.

Iquique and Huara

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather alert is in force for the Tarapacá Region:

Alert Forecast Start End
Alert AA72 Moderate to strong wind on the coast (25 to 40 with gusts of 50 km/h). 31/07 31/07

En consideración a estos antecedentes y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Tarapacá, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED declara Alerta Temprana Preventiva para las comunas de Iquique y Huara por viento,vigente a contar de hoy y hasta que las condiciones del evento así lo ameriten

Tarapacá

De acuerdo con la información proporcionada por la Dirección Meteorológica de Chile (DMC), se encuentra vigente el siguiente alertamiento meteorológico para la Región de Tarapacá:

Alertamiento Pronóstico Inicio Fin
Alerta AA72-2 Viento moderado a fuerte con desarrollo de tormentas de arena en sectores de cordillera de la costa y pampa de la región (entre 40 y 60 km/h). 31/07 31/07

En consideración a estos antecedentes y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Tarapacá, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED modifica la cobertura de la Alerta Temprana Preventiva por viento a Regional, vigente a contar de hoy y hasta que las condiciones del evento así lo ameriten.

Por otra parte, el Servicio Meteorológico de la Armada de Chile mantiene vigente su Aviso N°30 por marejadas normales, entre el jueves 31 de julio y el viernes 01 de agosto para las costas de la región.

Finalmente, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN), mediante su Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa, actualizada el día de hoy, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa tales como flujo de detritos, aluviones, deslizamientos y/o caídas de rocas (derrumbes) es alta en litoral, cordillera de la costa y precordillera y moderada en valle longitudinal y cordillera de la región.

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Maule, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantiene vigente desde el 28 de julio de 2025.

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

Cabe destacar que, los montos de precipitaciones de la tabla anterior contemplan el período entre las 09:00 horas del día indicado y las 09:00 horas del día siguiente.

Por otra parte, el Servicio Meteorológico de la Armada de Chile mantiene vigente su Aviso N°30 por marejadas normales, entre el jueves 31 de julio y el viernes 01 de agosto para las costas de la región.

Finalmente, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN), mediante su Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa, actualizada el día de hoy, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa tales como flujo de detritos, aluviones, deslizamientos y/o caídas de rocas (derrumbes) es alta en valles precordilleranos y precordillera y moderada en litoral, cordillera de la costa y cordillera de la región.

En consideración a este antecedente, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Coquimbo, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza laAlerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, que se encuentra vigente desde el 27 de julio de 2025.

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

 

Ñuble

Por otra parte, el Servicio Meteorológico de la Armada de Chile mantiene vigente su Aviso N°30 por marejadas normales, entre el jueves 31 de julio y el viernes 01 de agosto para las costas de la región.

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Ñuble, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantiene vigente desde el 28 de julio de 2025.

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

 

Los Lagos

De acuerdo con la información proporcionada por la Dirección Meteorológica de Chile (DMC), se encuentran vigentes los siguientes alertamientos meteorológicos para la Región de Los Lagos:

31-07

31-07

Por su parte, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN), mediante la actualización de su Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa emitida el día de hoy, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa, tales como flujo de detritos, aluviones, deslizamientos y/o caídas de rocas (derrumbes) es Baja en valle longitudinal y Alta en el resto de la región.

Asimismo, debido a diversos desbordes y crecidas de ríos se presenta la siguiente afectación en la región:

Comuna

Afectación

Fresia

Desborde del río Llico afectando aproximadamente 50 familias del sector Esperanza y Peuchen.

Cochamó

Producto de la crecida del rio Frio se produjo desborde, generando daños en puente y dejando aisladas a 23 familias.

Muermos

Crecida del río Llico afectando la ruta V-440, que une Llico Bajo con Yerbas Buenas, existe ruta alternativa para la población.

San Juan de La Costa

Anegamiento y aislamiento de sectores por crecida del río Liucura, además se indica riesgo de colapso por socavón en el puente Quilloimo, se dispuso corte de tránsito como medida de precaución.

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Los Lagos, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED declara Alerta Amarilla y cancela la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, a contar de hoy y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

Con la declaración de esta alerta, se alistarán escalonadamente los recursos necesarios para intervenir de acuerdo con la evolución del evento, con el objeto de evitar que éste crezca en extensión y severidad, minimizando los efectos negativos en las personas, sus bienes y el medio ambiente.

field_reports.description:
According to the information provided by the Regional Directorates of SENAPRED, in the context of the frontal system that is developing between the regions of O'Higgins and Los Lagos, the following background and developments are reported

WEATHER SITUATION

O'higgins

Overcast sky

Maule

Coast with overcast skies and light rainfall and inland overcast skies

Ñuble

Cloudy sky

Biobío

Overcast skies and intermittent rainfall

The Araucanía

Overcast sky and precipitation

Los Ríos

Overcast sky and precipitation

The Lakes

Overcast sky and precipitation

Source: SENAPRED Regional Directorates– 07:30 a.m. (07/30/2025).

RELEVANT EMERGENCY SITUATIONS BY REGION

O'higgins

No news

Maule

Ñuble

Biobío

The Araucanía

Los Ríos

Los Lagos Commune: 1 house with minor damage due to rainfall in the Quilmes sector.

Corral Commune: Mass removal that affects a neighborhood road interrupting the pedestrian crossing, 12 people are isolated (4 homes).

Commune of Valdivia: mass removal in the Balsa San Javier sector.

The Lakes

Fresia Commune: Overflow of the Llico River, affecting approximately 50 families in the Esperanza and Peuchen sectors.

Commune of Cochamó: As a result of the flooding of the Frio River, there was an overflow, causing damage to the bridge and leaving 23 families isolated.

Commune of Muermos: Flooding of the Llico River affecting the V-440 route, which connects Llico Bajo with Yerbas Buenas, there is an alternative route for the population.

Commune of San Juan de La Costa: 2 families are isolated in the Loma de La Piedra sector due to the flooding of the Huacamapu estuary. Meanwhile, flooding and isolation of sectors due to flooding of the Liucura River are reported. In addition, there is a risk of collapse of the Quilloimo bridge due to a sinkhole, traffic cut was ordered as a precautionary measure. Finally, bridges are reported cut in the Liucura and Quilloimo sectors.

Maullín Commune: 5 people affected and 1 house with major damage as a result of flooding in the Ten-Ten population.

Río Negro: 10 families are reported isolated due to the collapse of the El Bolsón Bridge. In addition, flooding is recorded in the yards of homes.

Source: SENAPRED Regional Directorates– 07:30 a.m. (07/30/2025).

SECTORAL INFORMATION

According to the information provided by the Superintendence of Electricity and Fuels (SEC), at the time of this report the following is reported:

REGION

TOTAL NUMBER OF CUSTOMERS WITHOUT POWER

The Araucanía

1395

Los Ríos

The Lakes

Total

2.649

It is worth mentioning that these power outages do not necessarily originate from the frontal system.

99.9% of the country's customers have normal electricity service

The Hydrographic and Oceanographic Service of the Chilean Navy (SHOA) reported that at 7:25 p.m. on July 29, an earthquake of magnitude 8.8 occurred in the Pacific Basin, with an epicenter 134 kilometers southeast of Petropavlovsk from Kamchatka, Russia. Information corroborated by the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center (PTWC).

SENAPRED at 07:25 a.m. on July 30, declared a Red Alert for tsunami for the communes of the continental coastal border between the regions of Arica and Parinacota and Magallanes, including the Insular and Antarctic territory, in force since July 29, 2025.

Meanwhile, at 10:30 p.m. yesterday, the National Disaster Risk Management Committee (COGRID) was convened, and at 7:00 a.m. today an Evaluation Meeting, in order to establish the coordinations and courses of action. In the same way, the Regional Directorates convened their respective Regional COGRIDs.

The evacuation processes have been carried out in an orderly manner. Additionally, shelters have been set up in some communes if necessary. On the other hand, the Ministry of Education suspended classes for all educational establishments, located on the coastal edge between the regions of Arica and Parinacota and Los Lagos, for today, Wednesday, July 30.

The Chilean Navy instructed that all vessels present at sea must remain in a 200-meter-deep shelter zone. Meanwhile, smaller vessels that cannot go out into deep waters must remain moored and anchored to the port.

The evacuation process will be supported by public security from Municipalities, Armed Forces, Firefighters, Carabineros and PDI distributing their personnel at strategic and required points.

Likewise, the evacuation process will be reinforced with the sending of SAE messaging for Tsunami Warning, Precautionary Status or Cancellation, as appropriate.

Finally, the response teams of the Disaster Prevention and Response System (SINAPRED) are deployed on the ground and evaluating the emergency situations derived from this event.

 

Evacuation processes

Concepción: Due to the threat of tsunami flooding in the area, authorities began the preventive evacuation of the local jail, transferring inmates to prisons in Concepción. At the same time, the hospital – also located in a flood zone – is evaluating alternatives for the transfer of patients and the protection of essential equipment and supplies.

 

Critical Infrastructure

Between the regions of Arica and Parinacota and Los Lagos, 5 prisons are reported to be below level 30, which are being evacuated. 33 health facilities in the regions of Tarapacá, Antofagasta, Coquimbo, Valparaíso, O'Higgins, Maule, Biobío, La Araucanía, Los Ríos and Los Lagos that are in the flood zone were evacuated (308 patients in total). Similarly, the immunobiological deposits (vaccines and immunoglobulin) of the communes of Lebu and Talcahuano in the Biobío Region were transferred to a safe zone. 

 

Operations are paralyzed in all ports from the Arica Region to the San Antonio Region; and without ships in Talcahuano.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Antofagasta, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the regional Preventive Early Warning for wind, which has been in force since June 2 and until conditions warrant it.

 

The updating of this alert is constituted as a state of reinforcement of surveillance, through the precise and rigorous monitoring of risk conditions and the respective vulnerabilities associated with the threat, coordinating and activating the National System for Disaster Prevention and Response (SINAPRED) in order to act in a timely manner in the event of possible emergency situations.

Por su parte, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN), mediante la actualización de la Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa, emitida en la jornada de hoy, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa es moderada en el tramo sur de litoral, cordillera de la costa, valles precordilleranos y precordillera y baja en el tramo norte de litoral, cordillera de la costa, valles precordilleranos y precordillera y cordillera de la región.

 

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Coquimbo, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por Evento Meteorológico, que se encuentra vigente desde el 08 de junio y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

 

SENAPRED recomienda a la población prestar atención a señales que podrían indicar la ocurrencia de una remoción en masa, tales como: lluvia fuerte y sostenida por mayor tiempo de lo normal; subida o disminución repentina de nivel y caudal en cursos de agua; aumento en la turbiedad del agua en los cauces; y fuerte ruido de fondo.

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Valparaíso, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva regional, a excepción de la Provincia de Isla de Pascua por evento meteorológico, que se mantienevigente desde el 09 de junio y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

 

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

Cabe destacar que, los montos de precipitaciones de la tabla anterior contemplan el período entre las 09:00 horas del día indicado y las 09:00 horas del día siguiente.

 

Por su parte, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN), mediante la actualización de su Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa, emitida en la jornada de hoy, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa tales como flujo de detritos, aluviones, deslizamientos y/o caídas de rocas (derrumbes), es moderada en los sectores de litoral, cordillera de la costa, valle y precordillera, y baja en cordillera de la región.

 

Adicionalmente, el Centro Meteorológico Marítimo de Valparaíso, mediante su Aviso N°22-B, prevé el desarrollo de marejadas normales para el borde costero regional, en el periodo comprendido entre el miércoles 11 y el lunes 16 de junio 2025.

 

En consideración a este antecedente y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de O´Higgins, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantiene vigente desde el 09 de junio y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

 

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

Por su parte, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN), mediante la actualización de su Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa, emitida en la jornada de hoy, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa tales como flujo de detritos, aluviones, deslizamientos y/o caídas de rocas (derrumbes), es alta en los sectores de litoral y cordillera de la costa, valle longitudinal y precordillera y baja en el sector de cordillera de la región.

 

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Ñuble, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED cancela la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantenía vigente desde 10 de junio del 2025 y declara Alerta Amarilla Regional por evento meteorológico, vigente desde hoy y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

 

Con la declaración de esta alerta, se alistarán escalonadamente los recursos necesarios para intervenir de acuerdo con la evolución del evento, con el objeto de evitar que éste crezca en extensión y severidad, minimizando los efectos negativos en las personas, sus bienes y el medio ambiente.

 

Biobío

En el contexto de las Alarmas, Alertas y Avisos Meteorológicos vigentes, emitidos por la Dirección Meteorológica de Chile (DMC), el Aviso de mal tiempo temporal emitido por el Centro Meteorológico Marítimo de Talcahuano, la actualización de la Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa emitida por el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN) y los reportes recibidos en las últimas horas por parte de las municipalidades de la región, se evidencia un aumento significativo de la afectación regional, con múltiples anegamientos, caídas de árboles, voladuras de techumbres, alteración de conectividad, interrupciones de suministro eléctrico, desborde de cauces y deslizamientos de terrenos en varios puntos de la región.

 

Además, la Dirección General de Aguas (DGA) de la Región del Biobío, mediante su informe hidrométrico regional, ha señalado la tendencia al alza de los principales cauces de la región.

 

Por otra parte, de acuerdo con la Resolución Exenta Nº 912 del Ministerio del Interior, se ha declarado emergencia preventiva para la Región del Biobío, desde el 11 hasta el 17 de junio de 2025, en atención al pronóstico de la Dirección Meteorológica de Chile. Como parte de esta declaración, se instruye a los secretarios Ministeriales de Educación a evaluar la suspensión de clases si las condiciones así lo ameritan, para no afectar los planes de estudio.

 

 

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional del Biobío, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED cancela la Alerta Amarilla Regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantenía vigente desde el 13 de junio y declara Alerta Roja Regional por evento meteorológico, vigente a contar de hoy y hasta que las condiciones meteorológicas  

Con la declaración de esta Alerta Roja, se movilizarán todos los recursos necesarios y disponibles para actuar y controlar la situación, dada la extensión y severidad del evento.

En consideración a estos antecedentes y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Los Ríos, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED modifica la cobertura y variable de su Alerta Temprana Preventiva para las comunas de Panguipulli, Futrono, Lago Ranco y Río Bueno por nevadas, que se mantiene vigente desde el 11 de junio y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

 

La modificación de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

SENAPRED recomienda a la población limpiar la nieve acumulada en techumbres y estructuras que puedan colapsar debido al peso adicional; y mantener despejados los caminos de acceso a viviendas.

Adicionalmente, el Centro Meteorológico Marítimo de Valparaíso, mediante la actualización de su Aviso N°22-B, indica el desarrollo de marejadas normales para el borde costero regional hasta el 16 de junio de 2025.

 

Producto de este evento meteorológico, a nivel regional se reportan 57 viviendas con daño menor, además de 15 personas aisladas en la comuna de San Juan de la Costa y 10 personas albergadas en la comuna de Purranque.

 

Cabe mencionar que las comunas de Purranque, Puerto Varas y San Juan de la Costa permanecen con Alerta Amarilla por evento meteorológico, y la comuna de Puerto Montt con Alerta Amarilla por remoción en masa.

 

En consideración a estos antecedentes, y en coordinación con la Delegación Presidencial Regional de Los Lagos, la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantiene vigente desde el 11 de junio y hasta que las condiciones así lo ameriten.

Yellow Alert for the Biobío Region is updated due to meteorological event

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), the following weather warnings are in force for the Biobío Region:

Alert

The end

14-06

15-06

For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for the Danger of Mass Removals, issued today, indicates that the possibility of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides), it is high in the coastal and coastal mountain range sectors , moderate in the longitudinal valley and pre-mountain range sectors and low in the mountain range sector of the region.

Additionally, the Maritime Meteorological Center of Valparaíso, through the update of Warning No. 22, forecasts the development of normal swells for the regional coastal edge, in the period between Wednesday, June 11 and Monday, June 16, 2025.

Finally, the General Directorate of Water (DGA) of the Biobío Region indicated in a regional technical table held yesterday, that based on its model of flooding of channels, incorporating the forecasts issued, there is a high risk of overflow of the main channels of the Province of Arauco and the coastal edge of the Province of Concepción. given the high amounts of precipitation that will be recorded in a short period of time, coinciding with the periods of high tide, which prevents the normal discharge of the rainwater systems of the communes.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Biobío, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Yellow Alert for meteorological event, which remains in force since June 13 and until conditions warrant it.

With the update of this alert, the necessary resources will be prepared in stages to intervene according to the evolution of the event, in order to prevent it from growing in extension and severity, minimizing the negative effects on people, their property and the environment

For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, issued today, indicates that the possibility of the occurrence of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides), is high in the longitudinal valley and pre-mountain range, moderate in the littoral, coastal mountain range and Chiloé sectors and low in the mountain range, interior coast, southern mountain range and sub-Andean Patagonia sectors of the region. 

On the other hand, as reported by the Provincial Presidential Delegation of Osorno and municipal staff, they indicate that as a result of the weather condition of the moment, flooded routes are recorded, trees falling, roof detachments, falling poles and alterations of the electricity supply in several sectors of the commune.

In consideration of this background, which entails an increase in the risk associated with these meteorological variables, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Yellow Alert for the commune of Purranque due to a meteorological event.  effective from today and until the conditions of the event warrant it.

With the declaration of this alert, the necessary resources will be prepared in stages to intervene according to the evolution of the event, in order to prevent it from growing in extension and severity, minimizing the negative effects on people, their property and the environment.

-----------------------------------------------

Power outage:

The summary at 11:49 p.m. on Saturday, June 14 is as follows, 392,884 customers are reported without electricity, which is equivalent to 4.9% of the country's customers. The most affected regions are La Araucania 124,230 customers, Biobio 155,151 customers, Ñuble 40,224 customers and Maule 16,927 customers. 

 

Most of the cuts are due to falling trees, poles or roofs on power lines. In addition, mass removals are reported in some areas.

 

------------------------

 

River flows:

 

At the moment no river overflows are reported, but several of them are at maximum capacity.

It should be noted that the rainfall amounts in the table above include the period between 09:00 hours on the indicated day and 09:00 hours the following day. 


For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for the Danger of Mass Removals, issued today, indicates that the possibility of the occurrence of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides), It is moderate in the sectors of the Cordillera de la Costa and the southern section of the pre-Andean valleys and the pre-mountain range and low in the coastal sectors, the mountain range and the northern section of the pre-mountain valleys and the pre-mountain range of the region. 


In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Coquimbo, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since June 8 and until conditions warrant it. 

 

Puerto Montt

According to information provided by the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED Los Lagos, on June 10 there was a mass removal at kilometer 10 of the Chinquihue V-805 route in the commune of Puerto Montt. 


As a result of the above, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), carried out a survey of information on the ground observing that mass removal is active, with constant sediment falls. It should be noted that the landslide process maintains a significant volume of unstable loose sediments, which, due to their condition and position, are estimated to slide in the short term due to the action of gravity, precipitation or other triggers. 

On the other hand, sub-vertical and tensile cracks are observed in a layer of a competent sand deposit of approximately 3 meters thick, located in the upper part of the escarpment forming a small cornice, evidencing that there are high possibilities of generating a new mass removal in the sector or in the surrounding sectors. 
Given the evidence of previous removals and given that the conditioning factors of high slope angle, intercalation of impermeable and permeable deposits that are poorly consolidated, groundwater circulation persist, it is considered that the entire slope presents a high susceptibility to mass removals, which could affect important extensions, it may block routes and/or affect infrastructures. 


Finally, as a result of the Meteorological Forecast issued by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), in which it indicates that rainfall will be recorded for the next few days in the region, SERNAGEOMIN carried out a technical analysis which determined according to its Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, that the possibility of occurrence of removals is moderate on the coast and low for the rest of the region. 


In consideration of this background, which implies an increase in the risk associated with this variable, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Preventive Early Warning for mass removal for the commune of Puerto Montt, effective as of today and until the conditions of the event warrant it.

For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, issued today, indicates that the possibility of mass removals such as debris flow, alluvium, landslides and/or rockfalls (landslides), is moderate in the sectors of the coastal mountain range and the southern section of pre-Andean valleys and pre-mountain ranges and low in the sectors of the coast, mountain range and the northern section of the pre-Andean valleys and the pre-mountain range of the region.


In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Coquimbo, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning for meteorological event, which has been in force since June 8 and until conditions warrant it.

 

Puerto Montt

According to information provided by the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED Los Lagos, on June 10 there was a mass removal at kilometer 10 of the Chinquihue V-805 route in the commune of Puerto Montt.


As a result of the above, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), carried out a survey of information on the ground observing that mass removal is active, with constant sediment falls. It should be noted that the landslide process maintains a significant volume of unstable loose sediments, which, due to their condition and position, are estimated to slide in the short term due to the action of gravity, precipitation or other triggers.

On the other hand, sub-vertical and tensile cracks are observed in a layer of a competent sand deposit of approximately 3 meters thick, located in the upper part of the escarpment forming a small cornice, evidencing that there are high possibilities of generating a new mass removal in the sector or in the surrounding sectors.
Given the evidence of previous removals and given that the conditioning factors of high slope angle, intercalation of impermeable and permeable deposits that are poorly consolidated, groundwater circulation persist, it is considered that the entire slope presents a high susceptibility to mass removals, which could affect important extensions, being able to block routes and/or affect infrastructures.


Finally, as a result of the Meteorological Forecast issued by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), in which it indicates that rainfall will be recorded for the next few days in the region, SERNAGEOMIN carried out a technical analysis which determined according to its Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, that the possibility of occurrence of removals is moderate on the coast and low for the rest of the region.


In consideration of this background, which implies an increase in the risk associated with this variable, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Preventive Early Warning for mass removal for the commune of Puerto Montt, effective as of today and until the conditions of the event warrant it.

field_reports.description:
In response to the earthquake of greater intensity, perceived between the regions of Antofagasta and Coquimbo at 1:15 p.m. today, with maximum intensity perceived VII Mercalli in the Atacama Region, the following background information is reported: 

 

Report of the National Seismological Center (CSN)

Magnitude

6.4 MWW

Depth

65

Locality

54 km south of Diego de Almagro

 

For its part, after evaluations carried out by the Hydrographic and Oceanographic Service of the NAVY (SHOA), it is indicated that the characteristics of the earthquake do NOT meet the necessary conditions to generate a tsunami on the coasts of Chile.

 

SUMMARY OF THE SITUATION

 

Damage to infrastructure

Commune

Affectation

Copiapó

1 house is reported under evaluation on Felipe Mercado Street, Cartavio sector. On the other hand, the evacuation of the Palza Copiapó Mall was carried out. Finally, various damages are reported to facades and cornices in the downtown sector of the city, San Francisco Church, Alameda sector and Plaza Real Building.

Chañaral

Damaged electricity poles are reported. Municipal personnel work in the affected sectors.

Diego de Almagro

A number of homes are under evaluation.

Boiler

Minor damage is reported in the Red Cross building.

Connectivity disruptions

The presence of vehicles is reported on the roads of Route 5 (La Lobera sector and Plaza sector), Chañaral commune; Route 5 (piedra colgada sector), Copiapó commune, maintaining a road enabled for traffic; and at seven points on Route C-485, in the commune of Alto del Carmen, roads are working in the sector.

Alterations of basic services

A total of 29,900 customers have been affected by a power outage in various sectors of the Atacama Region. Meanwhile, no alteration in the supply of drinking water is reported.

Additionally, SUBTEL indicates that telecommunications operators report sites out of service due to power supply disruptions in the region.

field_reports.description:
Weather Event
According to the information provided by the Meteorological Directorate of Chile (DMC) and the Directorate
Regional of SENAPRED Los Lagos, at 3:30 p.m. on Sunday 25, the occurrence of a tornado was reported
in the commune of Puerto Varas, with a preliminary classification EF-1 (Fujita scale), with wind ranges
between 138 and 178 km/h.

 

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of the United States,
Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED maintains the Red Alert for the commune of Puerto Varas for
weather event, which has been in effect since May 25, 2025 and until conditions
so merit it.
It should be noted that a regional Yellow Alert is maintained due to a meteorological event.
On the other hand, according to what was reported by DGA, all monitoring stations at the regional level
they record their flows in normal ranges (green).

 

In order to assess the impact derived from this event and coordinate the respective courses of action,
carried out 2 regional COGRIDs and 4 communal COGRIDs (Puerto Varas). While a new
Call at 4:00 p.m. tomorrow, May 27.
At the moment, the following are still working on the site:
● Staff of the SEREMI of Social Development in the preparation of FIBE Files (8 officials), in order to
to assess the damage to homes.
● Puerto Montt Fire Department, through 10 volunteers and 1 USAR vehicle with a
command.
● The Undersecretariat of Telecommunications (SUBTEL) maintains mobile telephony and vehicle roaming
of Claro's mobile antenna, in order to facilitate communications in the commune.
● 85 troops and 3 trucks of the SANGRA Regiment of the Chilean Army, in debris removal.
● 50 members of the Carabineros in debris removal work.
● 5 hopper trucks, 1 backhoe, 1 front loader, 1 generator set and 3 electric towers of the
Ministry of Public Works.
● 1 lighting tower of the Chilean Navy and continues with humanitarian work with a
debris removal equipment.
● 1 NGO drone UAV Chile.
● Community Directors of Disaster Risk Management (DRM) of the communes of Llanquihue and
Frutillar.
● 1 IST ambulance at the command post

 

Regarding the restoration of the electricity supply service in the commune, the companies CRELL and
SAESA is working on its replacement, while keeping 7 electrodependent patients with their
respective generator backups. In the same way, the SAR and Clínica de Puerto Varas, remain
working with a generator, without news or damage to its infrastructure.
It should be noted that 1 shelter remains enabled in the Fiscal Gymnasium.
Finally, it is indicated that drinking water and rail transport services are operating with
normality. The measure responds to the consequences caused by the tornado that hit the city
during the last few hours, leaving a large part of the commune without electricity supply and still affected
under evaluation.
We are also awaiting the conclusions of the National Committee for Risk Management of
(COGRID), which is currently meeting to provide guidance on the
emergency.

ADDITIONAL BACKGROUND:

Population: 52,942 inhabitants in Puerto Varas and 18,863 in Llanquihue approx.

Homes: 220 homes with damage under evaluation.

Hostels: 1 operating

Electric power: 1,549 customers are reported without electricity in Puerto Varas and 67 customers in Llanquihue. They point out that all registered electrodependent patients have an electrical backup supply.

Education: classes are suspended in all schools in Puerto Varas this Tuesday, May 27.

Notice 183-4 Normal to moderate wind with a probability of white wind on the coast and coastal mountain range 25/05 27/05
Notice 184-2 Normal to moderate snowfall in the mountain range 26/05 26/05
Notice 185-1 Probable thunderstorms with a probability of hail in the foothills and mountain ranges 26/05 26/05
Notice 187-2 Probable thunderstorms on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and pre-mountain range 28/05 28/05
Notice 189 Normal to moderate rainfall in the coastal mountain range and foothills 25/05 26/05

Additionally, the DMC in its Meteorological Threat Report issued during this day, 
indicates that the estimated amounts of precipitation (mm), wind (km/h) and high zero isotherm (m.a.s.l.), 
They will be as follows:

Zone May 25 May 26 May 27
PrecipitationWindPrecipitationWind PrecipitationWind

Streaks 70		 - - - -
Coastal Mountain Range 20 - 30 40 - 60
Streaks 70		 - - - -

(M.S.N.M)		 3000 - 2000 2000 - 1400 1400 - 3800

 

On the other hand, the Meteorological Service of the Chilean Navy maintains in force its Notice No. 18 for 
normal swells, until Saturday, May 24 for the coasts of the region.

Likewise, according to the technical minute for "Danger of Mass Removals" issued during this day 
by SERNAGEOMIN, it is reported that the probability of occurrence of removals is high in the precordillera;  
moderate on the coast, coastal mountain range and longitudinal valley; and low in the mountain range.

In consideration of this background, and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of the 
Biobío, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED updates the Regional Preventive Early Warning by event 
meteorological system, which has been in force since May 23 and until conditions warrant it. 

The Lakes

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), 
maintain the following weather alerts for the Los Lagos Region: 

Alert Forecast Start End
AA3 Alarm Development of tornadoes and waterspouts in the region 25/05 25/05
Notice 183-4 Normal to moderate wind on the coast, coastal mountain range, pre-mountain range, Chiloé and inland coast 25/05 27/05
Notice 187-2 Probable thunderstorms on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley, foothills, Chiloé and inland coast 25/05 25/05

 

On the other hand, and according to the technical minutes for "Danger of Mass Removals" issued during this 
SERNAGEOMIN, it is reported that the probability of occurrence of removals is moderate in 
coast, coastal mountain range, pre-mountain range and inland coast; and low in longitudinal valley, mountain range, Chiloé, 
Cordillera Austral and Sub-Andean Patagonia. 

It should be noted that a Red Alert for a meteorological event is maintained for the commune of Puerto Varas. 

Red Alert Monitoring for the commune of Puerto Varas due to meteorological event

According to the information provided by the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED Los Lagos, with 
In relation to the occurrence of a tornado in the commune of Puerto Varas, 8 people are reported injured, 2 
sheltered families and 109 homes with damage under evaluation. It should be noted that the teams deployed in 
land are carrying out the corresponding damage assessment. 

On the other hand, the suspension of classes was determined for Monday, May 26 in all establishments 
both public and private educational institutions in the commune.

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of the United States, 
Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED maintains the Red Alert for the commune of Puerto Varas for 
meteorological event, which is in force from today and until conditions warrant it. 

It should be noted that a regional Yellow Alert is maintained due to a meteorological event. 

During today, 2 Disaster Risk Management Committees (COGRID), 1 regional 
(Los Lagos) and 1 communal (Puerto Varas), in order to evaluate the impact derived from this event and coordinate the 
respective courses of action.

On the other hand, during the day tomorrow, Monday, May 26, the application of the FIBE files will begin in 
the homes in the sector, in order to quantify the damages derived from this event. It should be noted that 
A shelter has been set up in the municipal gymnasium, to provide shelter to the affected people. 

Meanwhile, the activation of emergency roaming was requested, in order to maintain communications in 
the commune. 

Population: 52,942 inhabitants in Puerto Varas and 18,863 in Llanquihue approx.

Electrical energy: 19,000 customers are reported without electricity in Puerto Varas.

Hostels: Municipal Gymnasium of Puerto Varas.

field_reports.description:
Red Alert is declared for the commune of Puerto Varas due to meteorological event

According to the information provided by the Meteorological Directorate of Chile (DMC) and the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED Los Lagos, at 3:30 p.m. today, the occurrence of a tornado was reported in the commune of Puerto Varas, with a preliminary classification EF-1 (Fujita scale). with wind ranges between 138 and 178 km/h.

As a result of the above, the following data on the impact on the commune are preliminarily reported:

  • 8 people injured.
  • 30 homes with damage under evaluation.
  • 1 supermarket with damage under evaluation.
  • falling trees and blowing up roofs.

As indicated by DMC, the following weather alerts remain in force for the Los Lagos Region:

Alert

Prognosis

Beginning

The end

AAA3 Alarm

Development of tornadoes and waterspouts.

25-05

25-05

Notice A183-4

Normal to moderate wind on the coast, coastal mountain range, pre-mountain range, Chiloé and inland coast.

25-05

27-05

Notice A187-2

Probable thunderstorms on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley, pre-mountain range, Chiloé and inland coast.

25-05

25-05

On the other hand, and according to the technical minute for "Danger of Mass Removals" issued during this day by SERNAGEOMIN, it is reported that the probability of occurrence of removals is moderate in the coast, coastal mountain range and pre-mountain range, and low in longitudinal valley and mountain range.

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Lagos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the commune of Puerto Varas due to a meteorological event, effective as of today and until conditions warrant it.

It should be noted that a regional Yellow Alert is maintained due to a meteorological event.

With the declaration of this Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized to act and control the situation, given the extension and severity of the event.

 

ADDITIONAL BACKGROUND:

Population: 52,942 inhabitants in Puerto Varas and 18,863 in Llanquihue approx.

Electricity: 14,910 customers are reported without electricity in Puerto Varas and 5,757 customers in Llanquihue. They point out that all registered electrodependent patients have an electrical backup supply.

Education: Classes are suspended in all schools in Puerto Varas.

field_reports.description:
Earthquake Magnitude 7.5 (Richter)  

At 08:58 this morning (continental time), an earthquake of magnitude 7.5 on the Richter scale affected the Region 
of Magallanes and Chilean Antarctica. Its epicenter is reported 305 km south of Puerto Williams, according to data 
of the National Seismological Center. A regional COGRID was developed and SINAPRED activated SAE alerts to the 
community to initiate evacuations. 
 
The Navy's Hydrographic and Oceanographic Service (SHOA) issued a report with the possible 
Impacts of water bodies: 
 
• Antarctica Base Prat 02-05-2025 11.35 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time). 
• Antarctica Base O'Higgins 02-05-2025 12.00 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time). 
• Caleta Meteoro 02-05-2025 13.49 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time). 
• Puerto Williams 02-05-2025 14.50 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time). 
• Puerto Edén 02-05-2025 21.07 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time). 
• Punta Arenas 03-05-2025 02.25 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time). 
• Bahía Gregorio 03-05-2025 02.26 (Aysén and Magallanes Region time).

After the 7.5 Mww earthquake, a total of 63 aftershocks have been recorded at the time of issuance of this BIE, 
of which those above 4.0 Mww on the Richter scale stand out: 

• 09:07 – 6.1 Mww at 245 km S of Pto. Williams 
• 09:55 – 5.3 Mww at 239 km S of Pto. Williams 
• 10:12 – 4.4 Mww at 212 km S of Pto. Williams 
• 10:38 – 5.1 Mww at 256 km S of Pto. Williams

• 10:43 – 5.0 Mww at 235 km S of Pto. Williams 
• 11:10 – 4.1 Mww at 212 km S of Pto. Williams 
• 11:18 – 5.0 Mww at 227 km SW of Pto Williams 
• 11:25 – 5.0 Mww at 248 km S of Pto Williams 
• 11:27 – 4.0 Mww at 217 km S of Pto Williams 
• 11:42 – 4.8 Mww at 212 km S of Pto Williams 
• 12:06 – 4.3 Mww 192 km S of Pto Williams 
• 12:25 – 4.4 Mww at 214 km S of Pto Williams 
• 12:43 – 4.4 Mww 201 km S of Pto Williams 
• 12:48 – 5.4 Mww at 248 km S of Pto Williams 
• 13:08 – 4.3 Mww 248 km S of Pto Williams 
• 13:44 – 4.5 Mww 232 km S of Pto Williams 
• 13:59 – 6.3 Mww 271 km S of Pto Williams 
• 14:09 – 4.0 Mww at 222 km S of Pto Williams 
• 14:20 – 4.5 Mww 226 km S of Pto Williams 
• 14:25 – 4.1 Mww 261 km S of Pto Williams 
• 14:58 – 4.2 Mww 205 km S of Pto Williams 
• 15:17 – 4.6 Mww 224 km S of Pto Williams 
• 15:33 – 4.7 Mww 236 km S of Pto Williams 
• 15:42 – 4.2 Mww 258 km S of Pto Williams 
• 15:58 – 4.7 Mww 248 km S of Pto Williams 
• 16:14 – 5.3 Mww at 245 km S of Pto Williams 
• 17:09 – 4.3 Mww 245 km S of Pto Williams

10:38 AM: SENAPRED for its part issued a Red Alert for Tsunami. 
 
13:12: SENAPRED cancels the evacuation due to Tsunami in Antarctic Territory and issues a State of Precaution 
for the rest of the Magallanes Region. 
 
15:59: SENAPRED cancels the Tsunami State of Precaution for the Magallanes Region.

field_reports.description:
Event Summary:

On February 25, 2025, around 3:16 p.m., there was a massive power outage in Chile, affecting more than 98% of households from Arica to the Los Lagos Region. The interruption was caused by a disconnection in the 500 kV transmission system in the Norte Chico.

Current Situation:

  • As of the morning of February 26, about 220,000 customers are still without power, mainly in the northern zone and the Metropolitan Region.
  • The most affected regions are:
    • Tarapacá: 110,574 homes without electricity
    • Antofagasta: 63,926 households
    • Arica and Parinacota: 57,257 households
    • Metropolitan Region: 44,574 households
  • Most of the affected households have more than one inhabitant, which increases the number of people impacted.

Additional Impact:

  • The blackout caused the death of 3 electrodependent people.
  • The situation affected the operation of traffic lights, so it was recommended to take extreme precautions when driving.

Emergency Measures:

  • A curfew was implemented between 10:00 p.m. on February 25 and 6:00 a.m. on February 26, resulting in the arrest of 207 people, some for curfew violations and others for crimes committed during patrols.
  • The state of catastrophe was lifted, eliminating the curfew in regions with restored power supply.

Compensation:

  • It is not yet known whether compensation will be offered for the damage caused, although the government is monitoring the situation and will continue to evaluate the necessary measures.

Statements by Authorities:

  • Interior Minister Carolina Tohá provided updates on the restoration of electric service, noting that more than 94% of customers already have power, although supply remains unstable in some areas.
  • The Undersecretary of the Interior, Luis Cordero, mentioned that about 370,000 people still do not have electricity, mainly in the north.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Other - 02-2025 - Power outage #3 (2025-02-26)

field_reports.description:
Consolidated Report on the Emergency for Alteration of the Electricity Supply (February 25, 2025)

Update at 9:55 p.m.

Current Situation by Regions:

  1. Arica and Parinacota:

    • Gradual recovery of the electricity supply in several sectors of the commune of Arica (currently, 16% of the commune has energy).

  2. Tarapacá:

    • Emergency services operate with electrical backup systems.

  3. Antofagasta:

    • 80% of the region has already recovered its electricity supply.

  4. Atacama:

    • The provinces of Chañaral and Huasco already have a full electricity supply.
    • Hospitals and health centers operate with electrical backup, while the Los Loros rural post has no backup and has referred patients to CESFAM Tierra Amarilla.
    • 7,870 customers are affected by the alteration of the drinking water supply in Caldera and Copiapó.

  5. Coquimbo:

    • La Florida Airport is operating with a backup generator.
    • Carabineros control traffic at critical points on Route 5.
    • Hospitals and SAMU CR operate with electrical backup.

  6. Valparaiso:

    • All emergency services operate with backup equipment.
  7. Metropolitan: 
    • Metro stations have been evacuated, as have trains, and EFE has suspended operations between Alameda and Nos.
    • There have been incidents of entrapment in elevators in several buildings.
    • A generator failure at the Sotero del Río Hospital has been resolved with CGE support.
    • The traffic light network is affected by more than 80% (3,175 out of service), although the mobility network, rural transport, and bus terminals are operating.

  8. O'higgins:

    • Rancagua: The SAMU informs that SAR Oriente is out of operation. The Rancagua Penitentiary Center operates entirely with a generator, with autonomy of 12 hours.
    • In San Vicente, the hospital has failures in its auxiliary generator.
    • In Pichidegua, there are problems with the hospital's generator.
    • Cistern trucks have been implemented for the distribution of drinking water in Palmilla due to the lack of generator in SSR in the area.

  9. Maule:

    • Intermittency in lines 132 of Firefighters, 133 of Carabineros, and 134 of the PDI.

  10. Ñuble:

    • Emergency services operate with backup systems.

  11. Biobío:

    • 103 Rural Sanitary Services (SSR) do not have electricity backup, affecting 23 communes and a total of 54,011 people without water supply.

  12. La Araucanía:

    • The situation of the SSRs is evaluated in the event of possible electrical backup failures.
    • Hospitals in the provinces of Malleco and Cautín are operating normally with electrical backup and autonomy of 72 hours.
    • The Temuco Regional Hospital also works with a generator.
    • Regional airport is operating normally.
    • 128 SSRs operate with 6 to 8 hours of autonomy backup. 190 SSRs are without backup, affecting 35,030 people.

  13. Los Ríos:

    • Hospitals in the region have 48-hour power backup.

  14. Los Lagos:

    • The Cardenal Samoré Border Crossing is closed due to the lack of backup equipment.
    • The province of Palena is not affected by the power outage.

Actions Taken and Measures Taken:

  1. Call for proposals from COGRID Nacional:

    • A new meeting of COGRID Nacional has been convened at the offices of SENAPRED Central, scheduled for February 26 at 07:00 hours.

  2. Constitutional State of Exception of Catastrophe:

    • By means of Decree No. 66, a State of Constitutional Exception of Catastrophe has been declared.
    • A curfew has been established between 10:00 p.m . today and 6:00 a.m . the following day, affecting the regions between Arica and Parinacota and Los Lagos. The measures will be evaluated the following day, according to the restoration of the electricity supply.

  3. Suspension of Classes:

    • The Ministry of Education has reported the suspension of classes in all establishments in the affected regions by February 26, 2025, regardless of whether the electricity supply is restored.

  4. Ministry of Health:

    • Electrodependent people continue to be autonomous, and the delivery of batteries or fuel is carried out in collaboration with companies.
    • All hospitals and health centers in the network operate with electrical backup, guaranteeing the continuity of medical care, including the cold chain for vaccines.

  5. Transport and Mobility:

    • The Ministry of Transport has suspended the Metro and EFE network, but has reinforced the transport system through the RED bus network (more than 150 buses).
    • The International Airport is operating normally.

  6. Ministry of Public Works:

    • Sanitation companies have contingency plans with autonomy that vary between 6 and 40 hours, depending on the region.
    • It is reported that there may be occasional effects on buildings that depend on generators to supply water.

  7. Public safety:

    • The call to take precautions due to the suspension of traffic lights is reinforced. Carabineros are carrying out traffic control and ensuring public safety in the affected regions.

  8. Penitentiary System:

    • The entire national prison system is still operational with electrical backups.

Next Steps:

  • The gradual recovery of the electricity supply will continue, and the measures adopted will be evaluated as service is restored in each region.
  • Inter-institutional coordination between national and local authorities is maintained to ensure the well-being of people and the restoration of essential services.

Fountain: Regional Directorates of SENAPRED, NATIONAL ELECTRICITY COORDINATOR, NATIONAL COGRID, and the National Early Warning Unit – SENAPRED.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Other - 02-2025 - Power outage #2 (2025-02-26)

field_reports.description:
Communiqué N1:

The national electricity coordinator reports that at 3:16 p.m. there was an electrical interruption from Arica to the Los Lagos region, caused by a disconnection of the 500kV transmission system in the Norte Chico.

The national electricity coordinator activated the service recovery plan to restore consumption in the shortest time. 

The causes of this cut are being investigated.

-----------------------------------------------

Additional information collected from secondary sources:

  • It is estimated that more than 18,000,000 people are affected throughout the country.
  • National COGRID was activated in SENAPRED.
  • The most sensitive systems, such as hospitals, have backup services to have autonomy for a few more hours.
  • New measures will be evaluated by the government if the cut lasts until the evening.
  • There are cities where traffic lights are affected, which is why mobility problems are being generated. 
  • The metro system of the Metropolitan Region was stopped and passengers were evacuated for safety.
  • Firefighters from different cities are responding to various calls for people trapped in elevators, rides, among others.
  • There is intermittency in mobile services, both in telephone signal and internet.
  • In some areas, drinking water supply cuts are occurring, specifically in buildings and high areas of some cities.
  • Carabineros and municipal security services on the ground are reinforced.
  • EFE suspends services between Alameda and Nos.
  • Rancagua: SAMU informs that SAR Oriente is out of operation.
  • San Vicente: Hospital has failures in its auxiliary generator system.
  • Rengo: Firefighters without line 132
  • Pichidegua: Problems in hospital generator.
  • R. Maule: Intermittency in emergency lines.

field_reports.description:
Weather Event:


Arica and Parinacota
According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), there are
the following weather alerts are in force for the Region of Arica and Parinacota:

Notice A20-9 Probable thunderstorms in the foothills and mountain ranges,
preferably during the afternoon and night with precipitation
Isolated.
11-02 16-02
Notice A47-1 Normal to moderate rainfall in the foothills and
mountain range.
12-02 12-02

For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN) through its Update of
Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of removals
By mass it is high for the mountain range, moderate in the foothills and low on the coast, Cordillera de la Costa and Pampa de
the region.

Tarapacá

Notice A20-9 Probable thunderstorms in the foothills and mountain ranges,
preferably during the afternoon-night, with precipitation
Isolated.
11-02 16-02
Notice A47-1 Normal to moderate rainfall in the foothills and
mountain range.
12-02 12-02


For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN) through its Update of
Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of removals
By mass it is high in the mountain range, moderate in the foothills and low on the coast, Cordillera de la Costa and Pampa de
the region.

Antofagasta

Alert AA12 Moderate to heavy rainfall in a short period of time
in the salt flats.
12-02 13-02
Alert AA13 thunderstorms with probability of heavy rainfall
in a short period of time in the salt flats.
12-02 12-02
Notice A20-9 Probable thunderstorms preferably during the
afternoon-night, with isolated rainfall in the foothills,
precordillera, salt flats and mountain ranges.
11-02 16-02
Notice A47-1 Normal to moderate rainfall in the precordillera, salar and
mountain range.

For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN) through its Update of
Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of mass removals is high in the mountain range and pre-mountain range and low in the coast, coastal mountain range, pampa and pre-mountain range
western part of the region.

 

Volcanic Activation
According to information provided by the Volcanic Observatory of the Southern Andes (OVDAS)
of the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), the Láscar Volcano modifies its alert level
technique from Green to Yellow.

According to the latest Special Report on Volcanic Activity (REAV), issued during this day by the
SERNAGEOMIN, it is indicated that since the first days of February of this year, changes have been identified
in the monitoring parameters, those that exhibit an evolution in the dynamics of the volcanic system. The
above, is related to an increase in outgassing that exceeds 2 kilometers above the level of the
crater, an increase in SO₂ anomalies to the atmosphere, with a range record of 752 tons
during the day of this Wednesday, February 11, and an increase in thermal radiance inside the crater.
Volcanic seismicity does not yet show clear variations related to this phenomenon; however
Some earthquakes registered after the beginning of the aforementioned increase stand out, such as the 7th and 9th
respectively. This seismicity could be related to the dynamic evolution of the system
surface, where a transient overpressure would cause it to open.

In this way, and due to an evident increase in the levels of volcanic activity detected, and in the face of the
possibility of occurrence of minor eruptive pulses, SERNAGEOMIN decided to modify its technical alert
a Yellow for the Láscar Volcano, considering a possible area of 1 kilometer of affectation around the crater
active of the volcano. SENAPRED, in coordination with the Presidential Delegation, will determine a security perimeter of 10 kilometers around the crater, a measure that will restrict entry to said area and allow access control .

According to the information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC), there are
the following weather alerts are in force for the Region of Arica and Parinacota:

Notice A20-9 Probable thunderstorms in the foothills and mountain ranges,
preferably during the afternoon and night with precipitation
Isolated.
11-02 16-02

mountain range.

Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of removals
By mass it is high for the mountain range, moderate in the foothills and low on the coast, Cordillera de la Costa and Pampa de
the region.

Tarapacá

Notice A20-9 Probable thunderstorms in the foothills and mountain ranges,
preferably during the afternoon-night, with precipitation
Isolated.
11-02 16-02

12-02 12-02


For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN) through its Update of
Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of removals

the region.

Antofagasta

in the salt flats.
12-02 13-02

in a short period of time in the salt flats.
12-02 12-02

afternoon-night, with isolated rainfall in the foothills,
precordillera, salt flats and mountain ranges.
11-02 16-02

mountain range.

For its part, the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN) through its Update of
Technical Minute for Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of mass removals is high in the mountain range and pre-mountain range and low in the coast, coastal mountain range, pampa and pre-mountain range
western part of the region.

 

Volcanic Activation
According to information provided by the Volcanic Observatory of the Southern Andes (OVDAS)
of the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), the Láscar Volcano modifies its alert level
technique from Green to Yellow.

According to the latest Special Report on Volcanic Activity (REAV), issued during this day by the
SERNAGEOMIN, it is indicated that since the first days of February of this year, changes have been identified
in the monitoring parameters, those that exhibit an evolution in the dynamics of the volcanic system. The
above, is related to an increase in outgassing that exceeds 2 kilometers above the level of the
crater, an increase in SO₂ anomalies to the atmosphere, with a range record of 752 tons
during the day of this Wednesday, February 11, and an increase in thermal radiance inside the crater.
Volcanic seismicity does not yet show clear variations related to this phenomenon; however
Some earthquakes registered after the beginning of the aforementioned increase stand out, such as the 7th and 9th
respectively. This seismicity could be related to the dynamic evolution of the system
surface, where a transient overpressure would cause it to open.

In this way, and due to an evident increase in the levels of volcanic activity detected, and in the face of the
possibility of occurrence of minor eruptive pulses, SERNAGEOMIN decided to modify its technical alert
a Yellow for the Láscar Volcano, considering a possible area of 1 kilometer of affectation around the crater
active of the volcano. SENAPRED, in coordination with the Presidential Delegation, will determine a security perimeter of 10 kilometers around the crater, a measure that will restrict entry to the area and allow access control.
