field_reports.description:
Volcanic Activation Lascar Volcano

The information provided on 12-02-2025 is maintained.

According to information provided by the Volcanic Observatory of the Southern Andes (OVDAS)
of the National Geology and Mining Service (SERNAGEOMIN), the Láscar Volcano modifies its alert level
Green to Yellow technique

According to the latest Special Report on Volcanic Activity (REAV), issued during this day by the
SERNAGEOMIN, it is indicated that since the first days of February of this year, changes have been identified
in the monitoring parameters, those that exhibit an evolution in the dynamics of the volcanic system. The
above, is related to an increase in outgassing that exceeds 2 kilometers above the level
from the crater, an increase in SO₂ anomalies to the atmosphere, with a range record of 752
tons during the day of this Wednesday, February 11, and an increase in thermal radiance inside
of the crater.

Volcanic seismicity does not yet show clear variations related to this phenomenon; however
Some earthquakes registered after the beginning of the aforementioned increase stand out, such as the 7th and 9th
respectively. This seismicity could be related to the dynamic evolution of the system
surface, where a transient overpressure would cause it to open.

In this way, and due to an evident increase in the levels of volcanic activity detected, and in the face of the
possibility of occurrence of minor eruptive pulses, SERNAGEOMIN decided to modify its alert
technical to Yellow for the Láscar Volcano, considering a possible area of 1 kilometer of affectation around
to the active crater of the volcano.

SENAPRED, in coordination with the Presidential Delegation, will determine a security perimeter of 10
kilometers around the crater, a measure that will restrict access to the area and allow access control.

The release of rocky masses, gas and magma, could affect cities such as San Pedro de Atacama and Talabre in the first instance, affecting sectors such as Calama in Chilean territory and due to the winds (West to East), could generate significant effects in populated sectors in the Argentine Province of Jujuy.
 
Puyehue-Cordón Caulle Volcano Volcanic Activation

The seismological activity for the period has been characterized by the registration of 86 VT-type seismic events,
associated with rock fracturing (Volcano-Tectonic). The most energetic earthquake presented a value of
Local magnitude (ML) equal to 1.5, located 1.9 km north of the emission center of the year 2011, at a
depth of 6.3 km. 4 LP type seismic events, associated with fluid dynamics within the system
volcanic (Long Period). The size of the largest earthquake assessed from the Displacement parameter
Reduced (RD) was equal to 28 cm2.

The activity of the C.V. Puyehue C. Caulle has remained without significant variations compared to the last few years
months. During the period evaluated, seismicity was characterized by a slight decrease in both energy and energy.
and quantity. With respect to deformation, the inflationary process is maintained with rates similar to
previous months. Given the continuity of the deformation process and the presence of seismicity, it is maintained
the technical alert at: YELLOW TECHNICAL ALERT

The release of rocky material, gases and/or magma could put at risk sectors of Riñinahue, Rupumeica, Licán, Mantihue, Paso Cardenal Samoré and Anticura in Chile and the ash plume could negatively impact a large part of the province of Neuquén in Argentina.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Volcanic Eruption - 02-2025 - Volcanic Activity #2 (2025-02-14)

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riego

field_reports.description:
From the region of Arica and Parinacota to the region of Tarapacá, several thunderstorms have been generated. Between the regions of Antofagasta and Coquimbo, significant floods have developed in the Loa riverbed due to the summer rains generated in the Bolivian highlands.

Rapa Nui (Easter Island) in the Valparaíso region is under a warning for thunderstorms, so the evolution of the threat is monitored to determine the need to raise a Preventive Early Warning or of another type.

In the Magallanes region, strong winds have appeared, lifting a Preventive Early Warning that maintains permanent monitoring in the area for the duration of the event.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Pluvial/Flash Flood - 02-2025 - Weather Event and Wind #8 (2025-02-21)

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
Between the regions of Arica and Parinacota to the region of Coquimbo, a series of thunderstorms and rainfall derived from the Bolivian Upper have generated a series of effects, the most relevant being the increase in the course of the Loa River, affecting a series of communities located near its banks.

Along with this, in the Magallanes region, strong winds have generated the lifting of a preventive early warning, in order to monitor the phenomenon and avoid further damage.

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
As reported by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate, moderate to heavy rainfall is expected in a short period of time and thunderstorms between the regions of Arica and Parinacota to the Coquimbo region.

Due to the rainfall in areas of the Antofagasta region, the accumulation of water has generated the flooding of the Loa River, overflowing its course at multiple points and affecting nearby communities.

In parallel, a condition of strong winds was reported in the Magallanes region.

These meteorological phenomena have a strong degree of severity, with the probability of causing risk to people. As a result of this situation, SENAPRED issued a Preventive Early Warning (ATP) from the region of Arica and Parinacota to the region of Coquimbo, and in the region of Magallens, in order to monitor the evolution of these phenomena and take action with sufficient time.

These meteorological phenomena have a strong degree of severity, with the probability of causing risk to people. As a result of this situation, SENAPRED issued a Preventive Early Warning (ATP) from the region of Arica and Parinacota to the region of Coquimbo, in order to monitor the evolution of these phenomena and take action with sufficient time.

Along with the above, the Chilean Meteorological Directorate indicated strong wind conditions for the provinces of Magallanes and Tierra del Fuego in the Magallanes region, which is why SENAPRED indicated Preventive Early Warning to maintain permanent monitoring of this threat.

contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that began on February 8 together with a heat wave in the south-central area of the country, have spread to various regions, requiring the effort of different containment and combat brigades, led by CONAF.

There are currently 14 outbreaks in combat, with the Metropolitan, Ñuble, Biobío, La Araucanía, Los Ríos and Los Lagos regions being affected.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Fire - 02-2025 - Forest Fires #17 (2025-02-21)

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that began on February 8 together with a heat wave in the south-central area of the country, have spread to various regions, requiring the effort of different containment and combat brigades, led by CONAF.

There are currently 7 outbreaks in combat, affecting the regions of Valparaíso, O'Higgins, Ñuble, Biobío, Los Ríos and Los Lagos.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Fire - 02-2025 - Forest Fires #16 (2025-02-18)

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that began on February 8 together with a heat wave in the south-central area of the country, have spread to various regions, requiring the effort of different containment and combat brigades, led by CONAF.

To date, although the outbreaks have been decreasing, the region of La Araucanía continues to be the most affected in terms of damaged hectares, new outbreaks have been activated from the Region of Valparaíso to the Region of Los Lagos.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Fire - 02-2025 - Forest Fires #15 (2025-02-18)

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo y Desastres

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that began on February 8 together with a heat wave in the south-central area of the country, have spread to various regions, requiring the effort of different containment and combat brigades, led by CONAF.

To date, although the outbreaks have been decreasing, the region of La Araucanía continues to be the most affected in terms of damaged hectares, but a new point of concern has emerged in the Los Lagos Region, due to the advance of the emergency in the Argentine Andean Patagonia. where the fire in the El Manzano sector advances with crossing the border and entering the various national parks.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Fire - 02-2025 - Forest Fires #14 (2025-02-17)

contacts.name: Marión Sandoval Bequer
contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that began on February 8, 2025 have been concentrating their foci in the regions of Ñuble, Biobío and Araucanía, the latter region being the one that has had the greatest impact - in terms of hectares consumed - .

The government and forestry institutions have concentrated various resources for the permanent fight against the fires, as well as the implementation of measures such as the curfew, in order to limit the movement of civilians during times intended to combat forest fires.

contacts.title: Directora Nacional de Gestión del Riesgo

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that started during the last Heat Wave between the regions of O'Higgins and La Araucanía have been concentrating their foci in the latter region (La Araucanía), being the most affected with 9 foci in combat and with the highest concentration of damaged hectares (14,302 ha at the time of issuance of this report).

Different public and private institutions are combating these outbreaks, mainly concentrating the actions of CONAF and brigades belonging to forestry companies in the area.

The rapid expansion of the main outbreaks has put various urban areas at risk, requiring extreme resources and work shifts for the correct containment of the emergency.

The Chilean Red Cross maintains permanent monitoring of the various outbreaks, as well as the atmospheric conditions that may overcrowd the intensity and frequency, so that timely actions can be taken in the event of possible humanitarian assistance.

field_reports.description:
The forest fires that started during the last Heat Wave between the regions of O'Higgins and La Araucanía have been concentrating their foci in the latter region (La Araucanía), being the most affected with 11 foci in combat and with the highest concentration of damaged hectares (12,820 ha at the time of issuance of this report).

Different public and private institutions are combating these outbreaks, mainly concentrating the actions of CONAF and brigades belonging to forestry companies in the area.

The rapid expansion of the main outbreaks has put various urban areas at risk, requiring extreme resources and work shifts for the correct containment of the emergency.

The Chilean Red Cross maintains permanent monitoring of the various outbreaks, as well as the atmospheric conditions that may overcrowd the intensity and frequency, so that timely actions can be taken in the event of possible humanitarian assistance.
field_reports.summary: CHL: Fire - 02-2025 - Wildfires #8 (2025-02-12)

field_reports.description:
Decree of a State of Preventive Emergency, decreed by the authorities of the Government of Chile, for the regions of Ñuble and Maule, also decreeing a curfew for the region of Araucanía,

With the declaration of this Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized to act, given the extension and severity of the event.

At the moment, 29 Forest Fire Outbreaks are active in combat, which currently represents 13,329 hectares, in total there are 42,772.5 hectares burned. At the moment there are 28 unrecoverable destroyed homes, 48 damaged homes and a total of 76 displaced people.

The fire that caused the greatest concern is the one called San Carlos, in the commune of Collipulli, La Araucanía Region, since during the last few hours it reached the urban sector, even affecting the municipal stadium of this commune, this was being used as the air command post. but he has already resumed this activity. Thanks to the work of firefighters, CONAF and volunteers, this outbreak has remained controlled in the perimeter near the homes but is still active. In total, the commune of Collipulli is estimated to have a population of approximately 25,000 people. In addition, power cuts are reported in some sectors.

 

At the moment, the communes with the greatest danger are in the Region of La Araucanía, where various sectors of the Communes of Galvarino, Pitrufquén and Traiguen have been evacuated, where the fire is close to houses in rural areas.

The alert systems (SAE) have been activated that have allowed the preventive evacuation of communities near active outbreaks.

 https://www.conaf.cl/incendios/situacion-actual-y-pronostico-de-incendios/#reporteincendios

field_reports.description:
SENAPRED Meeting 05-02-2025:

After meeting in a new technical evaluation table due to the forecast issued by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate, which estimates high temperatures that will affect the regions between Coquimbo and Los Ríos, the authorities indicated that the strengthening of coordination between the different SINAPRED agencies in this scenario is maintained.

At the moment, the DMC has issued an Alert for an event of extreme high temperatures in areas between the regions of Valparaíso and the Ñuble Region, from the afternoon of Thursday, February 6 to the afternoon of Sunday, February 9.  In addition, three warnings for high temperatures are maintained that cover the regions between Coquimbo and Los Ríos.

"As a result of the above, a Red Alert has been declared for the Metropolitan, O'Higgins, Maule and Ñuble regions for extreme heat and a Yellow Alert for intense heat for the Biobío Region and for communes in the Coquimbo Region, and the provinces of San Felipe and Los Andes in Valparaíso," said Alicia Cebrián.

In relation to the occurrence of forest fires, the Minister of Agriculture, Esteban Valenzuela, indicated that "unfortunately we have 6% more forest fires than on the same date last season, however, there are 50% fewer hectares affected by the good work of all the actors who have been committed to firefighters, municipalities,  Armed Forces, Carabineros, PDI and Prosecutor's Office"

The authority reported that because it is estimated that in some areas the temperature could reach 40°C accompanied by wind, so it has been agreed with Conaf to close the national parks and reserves between the Region of Valparaíso and the province of Malleco.

"We reiterate the call to citizens to raise awareness and to be collaborators in the work being done by the regional systems and the National System of Prevention and Response to Disasters, and to collaborate by not using fire between today and Sunday since its negligent use has generated countless fire outbreaks during this period of greater recurrence,"  pointed out the director of Senapred.

Summary of alerts and alarms

- Chilean Meteorological Directorate:
Alert: Event of extreme high temperatures from Thursday, February 6 to Sunday, February 9.
Most affected regions: 
Valparaiso
Metropolitan
O'higgins
Maule
Ñuble

Alarm: Extreme High Temperature Event
From Saturday 8 to Sunday 9 February
Most affected regions:
Maule
Ñuble

- SENAPRED

Yellow alert for heat wave - high temperatures
Regions: 
Coquimbo: communes of La Higuera, Vicuña, Paihuano, Río Hurtado, Monte Patria, Combarbalá, Illapel and Salamanca
Valparaíso: provinces of Los Andes, San Felipe de Aconcagua
Araucanía: Malleco Province

Red alert for heat wave - high temperatures

Red Alert is canceled and Yellow Alert is declared for the commune of San Javier due to forest fire

Based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of La Araucanía, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED cancels the Red Alert and declares a Yellow Alert for the Commune of San Javier for forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it.

 

Red Alert is declared for the commune of Cholchol due to forest fire

Based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Maule, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the commune of Cholchol due to forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it. According to information provided by CONAF, it is reported that as of today, 01/27/2025 at 5:00 p.m., 17 fires are under control and 8 fires are being fought.

Red Alert is declared for the commune of La Ligua due to forest fire

Based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Valparaíso, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the commune of La Ligua for forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it. With this declaration of Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized, in additional support to what has already been deployed by CONAF, Firefighters and the National System for Disaster Prevention and Response (SINAPRED) in this way, action will be taken to control the situation, given the extension and severity of the event.

 

Red Alert is declared for the communes of Quintero and Quillota due to forest fire

Based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Valparaíso, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the communes of Quintero and Quillota due to forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it. With this declaration of Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized, in additional support to what has already been deployed by CONAF, Firefighters and the National System for Disaster Prevention and Response (SINAPRED) in this way, action will be taken to control the situation, given the extension and severity of the event.

 

Red Alert is declared for the commune of Catemu due to forest fire

Based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Valparaíso, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the commune of Catemu due to forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it. With this declaration of Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized, in additional support to what has already been deployed by CONAF, Firefighters and the National System for Disaster Prevention and Response (SINAPRED) in this way, action will be taken to control the situation, given the extension and severity of the event.

 

 

Weather Warning Maximum temperatures between the regions of Coquimbo and La Araucanía

As a result of the influence of a cyclonic circulation on the surface, together with the contribution of flow from the east, a significant increase in maximum temperatures is expected in the following sectors: - Coquimbo - Valparaíso - Metropolitan - O'Higgins - Maule - Ñuble - Biobío - La Araucanía

 

  • 2 houses totally destroyed

field_reports.description:
According to information provided by the Department of Fire Protection
CONAF Maule Forestry Companies, reference to the Villaboro forest fire east shows speed of spread
medium, medium front intensity, low flame length.
In consideration of this background and based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in
coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Maule, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED
maintains the Red Alert for the Commune of San Javier, due to forest fire, which has been in force since
on January 24, 2025.

Approximately 500 people were preventively evacuated from the sectors of Huerta de Maule and La Aldea. The people evacuated from the La Huerta sector were evacuated to  a shelter in the sector, since the beginning of the emergency they proceeded with the  activation of SAE (emergency alert system) messaging on 2 occasions on Friday providing for the protection of the communities of the La Aldea sector.

Current state in combat, with 450 ha at the time of the report.

As a result of this fire, SAE messaging was activated for evacuation of the population sector Santa Matilde, Quilapilún Bajo, Quilapalún in Tiltil.

In consideration of this background and based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Metropolitan of Santiago, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the communes of Colina and Tiltil due to forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it.

Working on site

  • Quilicura and Tiltil Firefighters
  • Roble 3 and Roble 5 Brigades
  • 6 CONAF aircraft

Regional Preventive Alert

The technical analysis carried out by CONAF indicates a high probability of generation and spread of forest fires, in view of the conditions of temperatures that will reach 33° and relative humidity that will drop to 19%. Likewise, the condition of Red Button will cover 523.5 thousand hectares for the period, with 33 affected communes.

Maule Region

Cauquenes

Red alert

Current state in combat, with 1271 ha at the time of this report.

In consideration of this background and based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Maule, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED maintains the Red Alert for the Commune of Cauquenes, due to forest fire, which has been in force since December 24, 2024.

Working on site.

Cauquenes Firefighters, 10 CONAF Brigades, 4 Arauco Forest Brigades, 1 Vista Hermosa Forestry Brigade, 7 CONAF Technicians, 4 CONAF Tanker Aircraft, 7 CONAF Aircraft, 4 CONAF Skidder, 2 Arauco Forest Skidder, 2 CONAF Tanker Trucks, 1 Command Post, 1 Vista Hermosa Tanker Truck and 1 Municipal Personnel of Cauquenes.

Biobío Region

Red alert

Hualqui

Current state in combat, with 20 ha at the time of this report.

As a result of this fire, SAE messaging was activated for evacuation of the Ranguel and Conihueco population sector in Hualqui.

In consideration of this background and based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Biobío, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the commune of Hualqui for forest fire, in force from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it.

Working on site.

Hualqui Fire Company, 6 brigades, 1 technician and 4 CONAF aircraft.

Regional Preventive Alert

The information provided by the Chilean Meteorological Directorate (DMC) and the National Forestry Corporation (CONAF) indicate that in the Biobío Region maximum winds of more than 30 km/h will be recorded in much of the region. together with a significant decrease in relative humidity below 25% and a dead fine fuel moisture of less than 6%. These conditions generate a highly favorable scenario for the occurrence and spread of forest fires.

Valparaíso Region:

LIMACHE:

Since the declaration of Communal Red Alert, for Forest Fire called "Valle Las Mellizas", which is taking place in the commune of Limache, Province of Marga-Marga.

The fire is currently under control.

03 people affected and 01 house destroyed is the result of the forest fire. The affected people correspond to 02 adults and 01 minor, who will be referred to the home of relatives. Personnel from the Community Development Directorate of the Municipality of Limache will carry out the FIBE file and deliver emergency aid.

Firefighters from Limache, Villa Alemana, Quilpué, 7 brigades, 5 technicians, 3 dromader aircraft, 1 tanker, 2 helicopter, carabineros, 1 GRD team are working on the site.

THE LEAGUE:

Since the declaration of the Communal Yellow Alert for the commune of La Ligua, due to forest fire, no information has arrived regarding damage, victims, affected, etc.

San Antonio – Cartagena:

Since the declaration of the Communal Yellow Alert, no information has arrived regarding Damages, Affected, Victims, etc.

Metropolitan Region. Route 68

It is cut off at the height of Cuesta Zapata due to forest fire: There is also a Red Alert in Lampa.

Batuco Lagoon

50 hectares, current state in combat. (RED ALERT), no report of damage or affected at the time of this report.

Working on site.

Colina - Lampa Firefighters. / 3rd Forest Fire Alarm, 4 Oak Brigades 9, 2, 18, 25, 2 Technicians, 1 Tanker (CC-AOQ), 1 helicopter (CC-CDN) and 1 Cistern Truck (CC Oak 29-25)

 

Biobío Region

PELAHUENCO V

Current state in combat, with 400 ha at the time of this report,

The National Disaster Prevention and Response Service (Senapred) has requested the preventive evacuation of the Toco Toco sector, activating the SAE messaging to alert residents (150 people).

Working on site.

Los Álamos, Lebu and Curanilahue Firefighters, 7 CONAF Brigades, 6 ARAUCO, 1 Arauco Company Supervisor Technician, 4 CONAF, 2 Arauco Operations Chief, 3 Arauco Aircraft, 1 helicopter, 1 Arauco Coordination, 1 C-130 aircraft, 2 AT aircraft, 3 Arauco Helicarriers, 2 Arauco skidder and 1 Arauco command post. Resources on the way: 1 skidder

field_reports.description:
According to the information provided by the Regional Directorates of SENAPRED, with
In relation to the present meteorological event, the following background and news are reported.
At the moment, the meteorological situation by region is as follows:

WEATHER SITUATION BY REGION
Atacama Mostly overcast sky.
Coquimbo Sky covered with precipitation.
Valparaiso Sky with partial cloud cover
Metropolitan Overcast Sky.
O'Higgins Sky covered with precipitation and weak wind.
Maule Sky covered with light rainfall.
Ñuble Sky covered with light rainfall.
Biobío Overcast sky.
The Araucanía Overcast sky.
Los Ríos Sky covered with intermittent rainfall.
Los Lagos Sky covered with precipitation.
Aysén Sky covered with precipitation and wind.

 

According to the information provided by the Superintendence of Electricity and Fuels
(SEC), at the time of this report the following is reported: 752,207 customers without electricity.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Atacama Region
• Freirina Commune: Alteration of connectivity on route C-480, Los Bronces sector.
• Communes of Vallenar and Alto del Carmen: roads on Route C-485, traffic enabled with caution.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Coquimbo Region

- A smaller vehicle tried to cross the Salala Estuary but was dragged by the current. Inside was 1 occupant, who was
rescued alive by Carabineros and Firefighters.
- SISS reports the closure of Bocatoma Las Rojas due to turbidity pulse. It is operating with a reserve tank.
- Vicuña Commune: Route 41-CH is closed as a precaution between Juntas del Toro and the border limit. Likewise, they remain
various routes with the presence of roads and activation of streams, recommending traffic with caution through them, in order to avoid
accidents.
- The situation of sheltered corresponds to homeless people in La Serena and tourists in the commune of Paihuano.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Valparaiso Region

- 1 person remains missing in the Playa Las Salinas sector (Capilla Naval). The Chile Navy (2 boats, and
ground personnel of the Military Police) and rescue NGOs.
- Electricity supply service in the prison in the commune of Quillota, is restored.
- Connectivity alterations: Padre Hurtado Avenue at "Polígono de Tiro" (Viña del Mar commune), Route F-90 at El Totoral Junction
(El Quisco commune), Route 318 and San Isidro underpass (Quillota commune), Route F-366 (La Cruz commune), Route F314 La Palmilla
(commune of La Calera) and Route F-301E (commune of Hijuelas).
- Cristo Redentor Cerrado Integrated System for all types of vehicles.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Metropolitan Region

- Damage to homes and impact on people in the communes of Pirque and El Bosque is under evaluation.
- Lo Prado Commune: Route 68 is interrupted in both directions as a result of water accumulation on the road.
- 23 health centers are without electricity supply, operating with a backup system.
- Quilicura Commune: 35,000 customers are without drinking water supply, as a result of work on the network.
- Falling trees are reported in different communes of the region.
- State Railroad Company (EFE) keeps suspended the operations in their entirety of the subdivisions between the region
Metropolitan, Port of San Antonio, Fepasa and Transap, there are also reports of damage to railroad tracks and detachment of roofs in
various company facilities.
- Immediately reported

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

O'Higgins Region

- Falling trees are reported in various sectors of the region.
- Activation of streams and increase in flow in various sectors of the commune of Santa Cruz.
- Connectivity alteration: Route I-732 (Santa Cruz commune), I-704 (Palmilla commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-10 (Graneros commune), Route H-1
210 (commune of Rancagua), Route H-734 (commune of San Vicente), Route H-754 (Quinta de Tilcoco) and Route I-86-J (commune of Chimbarongo).

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Maule Region

- Falling trees and blowing up roofs are reported in various sectors of the region.
- The damage to homes and impact on people in the commune of Rauco remains under evaluation.
- Mass removal in the La Pesca sector. Municipal machinery continues to work for the corresponding clearance.
- Curepto Commune: canal overflow keeps Route K-572 interrupted (Monte Maqui sector). Company waiting for improvement
of weather conditions to work in the area.
- Commune of Cauquenes: sinkhole on Route M-854 (between kilometers 2.3 and 2.8). Global Company carried out repair work and
At the moment, there is 1 lane for the circulation of vehicles. Routes M-750 and M-730 maintain traffic altered by channel overflow.
- Suspension of care at CESFAM Constitución (there are other alternative establishments).

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ñuble Region

- Search for missing person in the commune of Pinto, will resume during the morning of today, August 3.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Biobío Region

- 800 customers without drinking water supply in the commune of Tomé, due to rupture in the adduction of the drinking water plant due to landslides
hillside.
- Route 156 with vehicular traffic suspended between kilometers 0 and 26, except residents, commune of San Pedro de la Paz.
- In the commune of Arauco, a landslide of material is reported in the Las Agustinas condominium sector and 4 minor boats sunk.
- 7 establishments with damage to roofs and façade as a result of the wind in the commune of Concepción.
- Fall of the telephone antenna of the company Entel, Talcahuano commune.
- Biotren operational to Coronel and the rest of the section to Concepción has support buses.
- Various floods and overflows are reported in estuaries and rivers in the region.
- Falling trees are reported in various sectors of the region.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Araucanía Region

- Alteration of connectivity on Route CH-181 (communes of Victoria and Curacautín) and R-49 (commune of Collipulli).
- Falling trees are reported in various sectors of the region.
- Partial suspension of health care in facilities of Casa Mosso, Curacautín commune.
- MINSAL reports 11 health facilities of varying complexity, without electricity supply, operating with backup systems.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Los Ríos Region

- Falling trees, poles, blowing up roofs and collapse of sheds are reported in various sectors of the region.
- Failure of the Rural Sanitary Service in sectors of the communes of Panguipulli and Futrono.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Los Lagos Region

- Falling trees are reported in various sectors of the region.
- Landslide in the Detif El Cortado sector in the commune of Puqueldón. Operational route is maintained.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Aysén Region

Region is without news.

field_reports.description:
Biobío Region

  • Decree Disaster  Zone for the Biobío region, in order to mobilize state resources to the areas affected by the frontal system, activation of the SAE system due to the overflow of the Andalien River, Concepción, Estero las Plegarias, Curanilahue, Galvarino sector, SAE Alert for possible flooding Bellavista sectors, San Pedro, Las Rocas, Arauco, Biobío.
  • Suspension of classes on June 12 and 14, throughout the Biobío region with more than 1500 educational establishments. This measure will be applied to kindergartens, basic and secondary educational establishments, of a municipal, public, subsidized and private nature.
  •  Connectivity: It should be noted that the Biotren service suspended the passage of trains through the Biobío railway bridge, due to the increase in the flow of the Biobío River, the evaluation of routes of high influx due to possible landslides in urban-rural sectors is maintained. 
  • 4,665 Customers without electricity supply between the regions of Coquimbo to Los Ríos.

field_reports.description:
INCIDENT OR EMERGENCY REPORT
MONITORING BY METEOROLOGICAL EVENT

1. SITUATION SUMMARY
According to the information provided by the Regional Directorates of SENAPRED, in relation to the frontal system present in the south-central area of the country, the following background information is reported. At the moment, the meteorological situation by region is as follows:

WEATHER SITUATION BY REGION
Maule Cloudy and rainfall.
Ñuble Weak rainfall.
Cloudy Biobío.
La Araucanía Covered and weak rainfall.
Los Ríos Covered and weak rainfall.

 

EMERGENCY SITUATIONS AND/OR AFFECTATION BY REGION
Maule
• Linares Commune: alteration of communications of the
companies Claro and Entel, in the Chupallar sector as a result of a lightning strike
in telecommunications antenna, Vega sector. Company works in the
restoration of the service.
• Commune of Constitución: the landslide of material on the slope is reported
of Cerro affecting 01 house with damage under evaluation.
• Routes: Route J-755, J-743 in the commune of Molina, Route J-55 in the commune of
Romeral, Route J-25 of the Teno commune and Routes L-429 and L-45 of the commune
of Linares have been under traffic restriction since Tuesday, June 4.
• Educational establishments: classes suspended in the communes of
Cauquenes and Pelluhue.
• Border crossings: Disabled Pehuenche and Vergara international crossings.


Ñuble
• Commune of Chillán: flooding in different sectors, overflowing canals
under evaluation in the Las Coles-Cato sector.
• Communes of San Nicolás, Trehuaco and Bulnes: minor flooding in
various sectors. In addition, in the commune of Trehuaco, there are reports of rides in
Maitenco Bajo sector.
• Routes: Route N-630 at kilometre 4.9 interrupted by overflow of
river; Route N-350 interrupted from 2:00 p.m. Route N-655 restored.
• Sanitary Services: Rural Health Service (SSR) of the commune of Coihueco
is restored. In addition, in the commune of Chillán Viejo it is reported
the collapse of septic tanks due to flooding.
• Educational establishments: classes suspended in the communes of
Chillán, Quillón, Bulnes, San Ignacio, Cobquecura, Yungay, Portezuelo,
Coelemu, Trehuaco, Ránquil, and Quirihue; SLEP mountain range (Communes of San Francisco)
Carlos, San Fabian, Ñiquén, Pinto and Coihueco).


Biobío
• Commune of Concepción: houses with minor damage due to waterlogging and
detachment of roof.
• Tomé Commune: 03 houses with major damage due to landslides
material.
• Arauco Commune: landslides and minor sinkholes affected
minor en route. The Municipality is working on the ground.
• Commune of Santa Juana: flooded homes are recorded in various sectors
of the commune. In addition, the Wood Route is interrupted by
Tree fall. For their part, people isolated in the Saruca sector, due to a traffic cut
road through the overflow of the Huidulhue estuary.
• Antuco Commune: Route Q-45 interrupted due to the increase in the Pangue estuary. By
on the other hand, people isolated in the Villa Peluca sector, due to estuary runoff.
• National Parks: Closure of Nonguén Park, Laja Lagoon and wetland
The Batros.
• Educational establishments: classes suspended in the communes of
Colonel, tome, San Pedro de la Paz, Santa Juana, Lota, Talcahuano, Hualpén,
Penco, Lebu, Arauco, Curanilahue, Los Álamos, Cañete, Nacimiento, Alto
Biobío, Cabrero, Negrete, Yumbel, Antuco, Santa Bárbara and Quilleco.
•


The Araucanía
• Commune of Collipulli: 50 people are reported affected as a result of failure in
provisional bridge over the Niblinto River.
• National Parks: Preventive closure of Mocho National Reserve
Choshuenco and Villarrica National Park in the southern sector.


Los Ríos

No news of emergencies.

 


According to the information provided by the Superintendence of Electricity and Fuels
(SEC), at the time of this report, the following is reported:
Region No. of customers without supply
Maule 6,190
Ñuble 1,385
Biobío 1,472
La Araucanía 2,731
Los Ríos 164
Total 11,942
Source: SEC – 9:45 p.m. (05/06/2024).
It should be noted that the origin of the alterations in the electricity supply does not necessarily correspond to the event
meteorological.
2. CURRENT TECHNICAL ALERT
SERNAGEOMIN MINUTES DUE TO DANGER OF MASS REMOVAL

Detalle de alertas preventivas SENAPRED:

Región del Maule

 Se actualiza Alerta Temprana Preventiva para la Región del Maule por evento meteorológico | SENAPRED

Se actualiza Alerta Temprana Preventiva para la Región del Maule por evento meteorológico

De acuerdo con la información proporcionada por la Dirección Meteorológica de Chile (DMC), se encuentran vigentes los siguientes alertamientos meteorológicos para la Región del Maule:

Asimismo, el Servicio Nacional de Geología y Minería (SERNAGEOMIN) a través de la actualización de su Minuta Técnica por Peligro de Remociones en Masa, indica que la posibilidad de ocurrencia de remociones en masa es Alta en toda la región.

Cabe señalar, el Servicio meteorológico de la Armada mediante su Aviso n°19 que pronostica marejadas normales para las costas de la región a contar del martes 04 hasta el sábado 08 de junio del 2024.

En consideración a estos antecedentes técnicos, la Delegación Presidencial Regional del Maule, en coordinación con la Dirección Regional del SENAPRED, actualiza la Alerta Temprana Preventiva Regional por evento meteorológico, que se mantiene vigente desde el 31 de mayo y hasta que las condiciones meteorológicas así lo ameriten.

La actualización de esta alerta se constituye como un estado de reforzamiento de la vigilancia, mediante el monitoreo preciso y riguroso de las condiciones de riesgo y las respectivas vulnerabilidades asociadas a la amenaza, coordinando y activando al Sistema Nacional de Prevención y Respuesta ante Desastres (SINAPRED) con el fin de actuar oportunamente frente a eventuales situaciones de emergencia.

SENAPRED recomienda a la población informarse sobre las condiciones del tiempo; revisar y limpiar el techo y canaletas de las viviendas; mantener las vías de evacuación de aguas lluvias libres de tierra y desperdicios; evitar transitar a pie o en vehículos por zonas o caminos anegados; y evitar internarse en zonas montañosas, ríos, lagos y mar, especialmente cuando las condiciones meteorológicas sean desfavorables.

Likewise, the National Service of Geology and Mining (SERNAGEOMIN), through the update of its Technical Minute for the Danger of Mass Removals, indicates that the possibility of occurrence of mass removals is Very High in the pre-Andean and Andean areas of the region.

It should be noted that the Navy Meteorological Service through its Advisory No. 19 that forecasts normal swells for the coasts of the region from Tuesday, June 04 to Saturday, June 8, 2024.

In consideration of this background and in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of Los Ríos, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED, declares a communal Preventive Early Warning for Rainfall, for the communes of Panguipulli, Futrono, Lago Ranco and Río Bueno, effective as of today and until the conditions of the event so warrant.

The declaration of this alert constitutes a state of reinforced vigilance, through the precise and rigorous monitoring of risk conditions and the respective vulnerabilities associated with the threat, coordinating and activating the National Disaster Prevention and Response System in order to act in a timely manner in the event of emergency situations.

SENAPRED recommends that the population inform themselves about the weather conditions; check and clean the roof and gutters of homes; keeping rainwater drainage routes free of dirt and debris; avoid walking or driving in flooded areas or roads; and avoid going into mountainous areas, rivers, lakes and the sea, especially when the weather conditions are unfavourable.

The updating of this alert constitutes a state of reinforcement of vigilance, through the precise and rigorous monitoring of risk conditions and the respective vulnerabilities associated with the threat, coordinating and activating the National Disaster Prevention and Response System (SINAPRED) in order to act in a timely manner in possible emergency situations.

 

SENAPRED recommends that the population inform themselves about the weather conditions; check and clean the roof and gutters of homes; keeping rainwater drainage routes free of dirt and debris; avoid walking or driving in flooded areas or roads; and avoid going into mountainous areas, rivers, lakes and the sea, especially when the weather conditions are unfavourable.

 

31-05-2024 11:40

The declaration of this alert constitutes a state of reinforced vigilance, through the precise and rigorous monitoring of risk conditions and the respective vulnerabilities associated with the threat, coordinating and activating the National Disaster Prevention and Response System in order to act in a timely manner in the event of emergency situations.

SENAPRED recommends that the population inform themselves about the weather conditions; check and clean the roofs and gutters of homes; keep rainwater drainage routes free of dirt and waste; avoid traveling on foot or in vehicles through flooded areas or roads; and avoid entering mountainous areas, rivers, lakes and the sea. especially when the weather conditions are unfavourable.

field_reports.description:
In the Valparaiso Region, the Cerro Cordillera fire is being fought, affecting an area of 1.0 hectares. Despite its apparent small size, this forest fire is highly dangerous due to the particular conditions of the hills of Valparaíso. Currently, there is a threat to nearby homes, and several evacuations have been activated in the sectors of Chaparro Alto, Santa María, Guillermo Bravo, Chaparro, Calle Cantera, La Cantera, Cerro Alegre, Calle Campanilla, Cerro Alegre, and Alfredo Vargas Stoller, Cerro Alegre.

Fire Name: Cerro Cordillera
Status: In Combat
Affected Area: 1.0 hectares
Observations: The forest fire in Cerro Cordillera continues to be fought, with risk to nearby homes.

Evacuations:
- 9:36 p.m.: Evacuation of the Chaparro Alto sector.
- 9:49 p.m.: Evacuation of the Santa María and Guillermo Bravo sectors.
- 9:52 p.m.: Evacuation of the Chaparro and Calle Cantera sectors.
- 10:02 p.m.: Evacuation of the La Cantera sector, Cerro Alegre.
- 10:05 p.m.: Evacuation of the Campanilla Street sector, Cerro Alegre.
- 10:07 p.m.: Evacuation of the Alfredo Vargas Stoller sector, Cerro Alegre.

Resources Deployed:
- Valparaiso Fire Department
- 3 brigades and 1 technician from the National Forestry Corporation (CONAF)
 - On the way: 3 additional brigades and 4 CONAF technicians

The government convenes COGRID NACIONAL as a preventive measure.

Region of La Araucanía

According to the information provided by the National Forestry Corporation (CONAF), in relation to the forest fires that are developing in the country, the following detail is reported:

 

Red Alert for Wildfires:

Monitoring Red Alert for the commune of Victoria due to forest fire

According to the technical information provided by CONAF, the following detail is reported regarding the forest fire in the commune of Victoria:

Name of the fire

St. Louis 2

State

In Combat

Surface

1,500 hectares

Resources

6 brigades and 3 technicians from Conaf, 1 plane, 1 skidder and 1 helicopter from Conaf,

Carabineros, Army, municipal personnel and the Ruta La Araucanía Concessionaire.

At the moment it is reported that vehicular traffic on the R-86 route Victoria exit to Traiguén, which was affected by the smoke and fire of this fire, is enabled in both.

In consideration of this background and based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of La Araucanía, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED maintains the Red Alert for the Commune of Victoria, due to forest fire, which has been in force since February 18, 2024.

 

Red Alert is declared for the Commune of Purén due to forest fire

 

According to information provided by the National Forestry Corporation (CONAF), a forest fire is registered in the commune of Purén, according to the following detail:

Name of the fire

Lingue 4

State

In Combat

Surface

60 hectares

Technical rationale

Fire is developing near inhabited areas of the Ipinco sector. Likewise, the fire has a rapid behavior due to fuel and weather conditions.

In consideration of this background and based on the technical information provided by CONAF, in coordination with the Regional Presidential Delegation of La Araucanía, the Regional Directorate of SENAPRED declares a Red Alert for the Commune of Purén due to forest fire, effective from today and until the conditions of the fire warrant it.

With this declaration of Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized, in additional support to what has already been deployed by CONAF, Firefighters and the National Disaster Prevention and Response System (SINAPRED) in this way, action will be taken to control the situation, given the extent and severity of the event

State
In Combat

Surface
8 hectares

Fire is close to inhabited areas

With the declaration of the Red Alert, all necessary and available resources will be mobilized, in additional support to what has already been deployed by CONAF, the Fire Department and the National Disaster Prevention and Response System. State

field_reports.description:
Based on the report of the Chilean Meteorological Service, from Tuesday, January 30 to Saturday, February 4, an alert for extreme heat is presented. The current Meteorology alert considers the following areas:

Coquimbo region in the coastal mountain range, foothills and foothills valleys with up to 36°C.

Valparaiso region on the coast, coastal mountain range, foothills and foothills valleys with up to 39°C.

Metropolitan Region in the coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 38°C.

O'Higgins Region on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 37°C.

Maule region on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 38°C.

Ñuble region in the coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 37°C.

 

During the week there were different outbreaks of forest fires, but currently the ones with the greatest intensity and extreme characteristics are the fires that began on January 31 in the La Estrella commune, O'Higgins Region, which is still active with more than 2,500 hectares. In addition, in the Valparaíso Region on February 2, different fires started in the communes of Villa Alemana, Quilpué and Viña del Mar, which have destroyed homes and critical infrastructure such as communications antennas, road closures, among others. In the Maule Region there are active outbreaks, the most intense are those found in the communes of Pencahue and Curepto with nearly 1,000 hectares burned.

As of Saturday, February 3, 5:30 p.m., 45,812 hectares are declared affected by Forest Fires, with the Valparaíso region being the most complex due to the large number of urban areas exposed, in total this region has 12,939 hectares affected.

As of Sunday, February 4, 5:30 p.m., 51,783 hectares are declared affected by Forest Fires, with the Valparaíso region being the most complex due to the large number of urban areas exposed, in total this region has 15,345 hectares affected. The death toll is updated to 99, the Government comments that this number may increase until all the affected areas are registered.

This Monday, February 5 at 6:30 a.m., 52,166 hectares are reported burned throughout the country, in the Valparaíso Region there are 14,679 hectares burned.

From the region of the disaster, the Undersecretary of the Interior, Manuel Monsalve, has been in charge of reporting the 112 fatalities , of which only 32 have been identified, and that 38 autopsies have been carried out by the SML, which has been reinforced with forensic doctors from all over the country in the face of the emergency. In addition, there are 10 bodies that are in a condition to be handed over to their relatives.

Based on the report of the Chilean Meteorological Service, from Tuesday, January 30 to Saturday, February 4, an alert for extreme heat is presented. The current Meteorology alert considers the following areas:

 

Coquimbo region in the coastal mountain range, foothills and foothills valleys with up to 36°C.

Valparaiso region on the coast, coastal mountain range, foothills and foothills valleys with up to 39°C.

O'Higgins Region on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 37°C.

Maule region on the coast, coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 38°C.

Ñuble region in the coastal mountain range, valley and foothills with up to 37°C.

 

During the week there were different outbreaks of forest fires, but currently the ones with the greatest intensity and extreme characteristics are the fires that began on January 31 in the La Estrella commune, O'Higgins Region, which is still active with more than 2,500 hectares. In addition, in the Valparaíso Region on February 2, different fires started in the communes of Villa Alemana, Quilpué and Viña del Mar, which have destroyed homes and critical infrastructure such as communications antennas, road closures, among others. In the Maule Region there are active outbreaks, the most intense are those found in the communes of Pencahue and Curepto with nearly 1,000 hectares burned.

 

As of Saturday, February 3, 5:30 p.m., 45,812 hectares are declared affected by Forest Fires, with the Valparaíso region being the most complex due to the large number of urban areas exposed, in total this region has 12,939 hectares affected.

Most relevant areas with forest fires

 

Valparaiso Region:

 

 

Most relevant outbreaks with forest fires:

 



Information extracted from official sources, in this case SENAPRED's website. The numbers may be higher at this time but will not be updated until confirmation and publication in this official source.








February 02, 2024

 

In the case of the Valparaiso Region, where the greatest impact is found, the following is found:

 

There have been 23 evacuated areas in three communes:

 

  • Viña del Mar: Achupallas, Beagle Channel, El Olivar, Botanical Garden, Villa Arauco, Villa Hermosa, Villa Independencia, Villa Rucán and Reñaca Alto.

  • Quilpué: Chacao Channel, Los Pinos, Colinas de Oro, Teniente Serrano, Calichero, Pompeya, Chacao Channel, Los Lunes, Olympic Village and Población Argentina.

  • Villa Alemana: Patagual, Lo Hidalgo, Quebrada Escobares and Fundo el Rincón.

  • In the same vein, drivers traveling to Valparaiso were asked to postpone their trip and not transit to the coast to facilitate the support of the RM emergency teams heading to the region.



February 03, 2024

 

After the national COGRID, at 3:00 a.m. on Saturday, February 3, the Minister of the Interior, Carolina Toha, mentioned the following information:

 

The government authority mentioned that "we have had an evolution of fires that has touched areas with a lot of presence of urban areas, homes, people with effects that we cannot yet measure".

 

He added that this is a "complex, worrisome situation that requires a very intense deployment and measures commensurate with the seriousness of the situation in the region."

 

Similarly, he explained that "there are two main fires that are affecting Valparaíso, one in the commune of Viña del Mar and another in the commune of Quilpué."

 

In view of this, in Quilpué, "it is a fire of 850 hectares and - so far - we know of 100 homes affected". And in the commune of Viña del Mar, "the impact is much greater (...) We do not have a measure of the homes affected, it is estimated that there must be around a thousand, we do not have confirmed numbers of victims. Some reports speak of 10 people, others of 16 and we are going to have a consolidated number tomorrow."






Likewise, Tohá reported that due to the state of emergency in Valparaíso, a curfew is established between 8:00 a.m. and 12:00 p.m. for the following communes: 

 

  • Limache.

  • German Village.

  • Quilpué.

  • Viña del Mar.

 

The minister clarified that the curfew "is intended to ensure that in these places the transfers that are made are only linked to the emergency services and potential evacuations."

 

  • 3 Cesfam, 1 SAPU and 3 nursing homes affected by FIs.

 

Around 12:15 p.m., the update of the National Summary of IF is made.

 

The shelters that are enabled are the following:

 

  • Manuel Montt School, Villa Alemana commune (capacity 100 people).

  • Escuela República de Colombia, commune of Viña del Mar (capacity of 120 people).

  • Humberto Vilches School, Viña del Mar (capacity of 100 people).

  • Colegio Fernando Durán, commune of Quilpué (capacity of 50 people).

  • Liceo Ivet Vergara, commune of Quilpué (capacity of 166 people).

  • Escuela Concón Nacional, commune of Concón (capacity of 30 people).

21-01-2024





When the red alert was declared by SENAPRED, the Chilean Red Cross began to deploy its resources to help the most affected places.

The different National Directorates of the Chilean Red Cross, under the support and coordination of the Presidency and Executive Directorate, are beginning to develop actions according to their work programmes. The Risk Management Directorate liaises directly with Regional Committees and Branches to assess the situation of volunteers and affected areas. The Directorate of Health is monitoring the situation and has its equipment and support available to the affected areas. The Directorate of Communications disseminates infographics on SN social networks to reinforce the use of emergency kits and what to do in the event of evacuations due to forest fires. During the night of Friday, February 2, a technical table meeting will be held to coordinate work with the Valparaíso Region.

  • A checking account is created so that the community can make donations.

  • An FCR line is set up to search for people in the affected area and support from PHC.

  • Coordination is generated with Affiliates and Committees to have aid collection centers.

  • Aid requested by volunteers (masks, gloves, bandages, etc.) is coordinated.

 

The Anticipatory Action Team of the Chilean Red Cross is monitoring weather conditions for this weekend, which may cause forest fires to continue these days, especially for Saturday, February 3, extreme conditions are expected in sectors already affected.

 

The Information Management Team (IM) of the Chilean Red Cross reviews emergency information, consolidating data and reports from SENAPRED, CONAF, Firefighters, CONAF, Carabineros, government, media, social networks and contacts in the area. Information is received through a form in KoBo regarding the situation and actions of Affiliates. Information is consolidated in BIE to be shared in order to deliver this information to the SN so that the corresponding decisions can be made for the management of the emergency and support for volunteers in the field. 


Volunteers from Regional Committees and Affiliates monitor affected sectors and deploy according to local needs.

 

  • Valparaiso Regional Committee: Monitoring of the emergency, contact with National Directorates and support teams for the delivery of information and reports. Main needs: Masks, water, gloves, serum, bandages, gauze, dressings, work gloves.



  • Limache Branch: Contacted the affiliates mentioned in this same report to work together and support each other, in addition to volunteers moving to the Villa Alemana branch to provide greater support, likewise Limache coordinated with the emergency office waiting to act. 7 volunteers. They are working in Quebrada Alvarado, carrying out 82 services so far: 66 eye washes, 11 cures, 5 CSVs, 82 PHC services

  • Viña del Mar Branch: The Viña del Mar branch remains active waiting for your volunteers, the branch remains open while it is on constant alert for response. They are constantly monitoring and activating the Subsidiary. On the part of Risk Management, barracks are carried out in the Branch where a volunteer remains at the post communicating with remote volunteers, and another 4 attend shelters to support PAP work, cures and actions in general. Remote volunteers organize the participation of the other volunteers who attended the Branch the next day. Social Welfare 2 volunteers communicate with all the volunteers in the Branch to inquire about their well-being and their families.12 volunteers.

  • Quillota Branch: Contacted the subsidiaries mentioned in this same report to work together and support each other.

  • Olmué Branch: Contacted the subsidiaries mentioned in this same report to work together and support each other.

  • Villa Alemana Branch: The subsidiaries mentioned in this report were contacted to work together and support each other, in addition to the fact that the branch was activated while waiting for volunteers. 5 volunteers. Remote monitoring is maintained. Information by telecommunications of recommendations for the presence of smoke, forest fires before, during and after through social networks. Contact with the Municipality to take joint action. Active volunteers at the Affiliate awaiting confirmation to take action from the Affiliate.

 

Subsidiaries in the Valparaiso Region that function as collection centers are strategically selected by zones:

  • Los Andes Subsidiary

  • San Antonio Branch

  • Quillota subsidiary

  • Quilpué Branch

  • Playa Ancha subsidiary
field_reports.summary: CHL: Fire - 12-24 - South Central Zone Wildfires #3 (2024-02-03)

field_reports.description:
Basados en el reporte del Servicio Meteorológico de Chile, desde el martes 30 de enero al sábado 4 de febrero se presenta una alerta por calor extremo. La alerta vigente de Meteorología considera a las siguientes zonas:

 

Región de Coquimbo en la cordillera costa, precordillera y valles precordilleranos con hasta 36°C.

Región de Valparaíso en el litoral, cordillera costa, precordillera y valles precordilleranos con hasta 39°C.

Región Metropolitana en la cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 38°C.

Región de O’Higgins en el litoral, cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 37°C.

Región del Maule en el litoral, cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 38°C.

Región del Ñuble en la cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 37°C.

 

Durante la semana se presentaron distintos focos de incendios forestales pero actualmente los que presentan mayor intensidad y de características extremas son los incendios que comenzaron el 31 de enero en la comuna La Estrella, Región de O’Higgins el cual sigue activo con más de 2.500 hectáreas. Además, en la Región de Valparaíso durante el 2 de febrero se iniciaron distintos focos de incendio en las comunas de Villa Alemana, Quilpué y Viña del Mar, los cuales han destruido viviendas e infraestructura crítica como antenas de comunicaciones, cortes de carreteras, entre otros. En la Región del Maule se presentan focos activos, los con mayor intensidad son los que se encuentran las comunas de Pencahue y Curepto con cerca de 1.000 hectáreas quemadas.

 

02 de febrero de 2024

 

En el caso de la Región de Valparaíso, en donde se encuentra la mayor afectación se tiene lo siguiente:

 

Han sido 23 las zonas evacuadas en tres comunas:

 

  • Viña del Mar: Achupallas, Canal Beagle, El Olivar, Jardín Botánico, Villa Arauco, Villa Hermosa, Villa Independencia, Villa Rucán y Reñaca Alto.

  • Quilpué: Canal Chacao, Los Pinos, Colinas de Oro, Teniente Serrano, Calichero, Pompeya, Canal Chacao, Los Lunes, Villa Olímpica y Población Argentina.

  • Villa Alemana: Patagual, Lo Hidalgo, Quebrada Escobares y Fundo el Rincón.

  • En esa misma línea, se solicitó a los conductores que transitan hacia Valparaíso postergar su viaje y no transitar hacia la costa para facilitar el apoyo de los equipos de emergencia de la RM que se dirigen a la región.

 

Estos son los albergues habilitados:

 

  • Colegio República de Colombia | 10 norte 985, Viña del Mar

  • Centro de acopio municipal Liceo Guillermo Rivera | 11 norte 946, Viña del Mar

  • Liceo Comercial de Quilpue | Freire 495, Quilpué

  • Colegio Fernando Durán | Camilo Henríquez 126, Quilpué



03 de febrero de 2024

 

Luego de la realización del COGRID nacional, a las 3:00 horas del sábado 3 de febrero la Ministra del Interior Carolina Toha menciona la siguiente información:

 

La autoridad de Gobierno mencionó que "hemos tenido una evolución de los incendios que ha tocado zonas con mucha presencia de áreas urbanas, de viviendas, de personas con afectaciones que todavía no podemos dimensionar".

 

Agregó que se trata de una situación, "compleja, preocupante y que requiere un despliegue muy intenso y medidas a la altura de la gravedad que se vive en la región".

 

De igual forma, explicó que "hay dos incendios principales que están afectando en Valparaíso, uno en la comuna de Viña del Mar y otro en la comuna de Quilpué".

 

Ante esto, en Quilpué, "es un incendio de 850 hectáreas y - hasta ahora- sabemos de 100 viviendas afectadas". Y en la comuna de Viña del Mar, "la afectación es mucho mayor (...) no tenemos una medida de las viviendas afectadas, se estima que deben ser alrededor de mil, no tenemos números confirmados de víctimas. Algunos reportes hablan de 10 personas, otros de 16 y vamos a tener un número consolidado el día de mañana".




Asimismo, Tohá informó que debido al estado de excepción en Valparaíso, se establece toque de queda entre las 8:00 y 13:30 horas para las siguientes comunas: 

 

  • Limache.

  • Villa Alemana.

  • Quilpué.

  • Viña del Mar.

 

La ministra aclaró que el toque de queda, "tiene por objeto que en esos lugares los traslados que se hagan sean solamente ligados a los servicios de emergencias y potenciales evacuaciones".

 

 

ALERTAS VIGENTES: Actualizadas al 03 de febrero de 2024, 03:25 horas.

ACCIONES PREVIAS DE CRUZ ROJA CHILENA


Desde los primeros informes de SENAPRED debido a las altas temperaturas Cruz Roja Chilena comenzó con el monitoreo constante de las distintas zonas incluidas en la alerta temprana preventiva.

Las distintas Direcciones Nacionales de Cruz Roja Chilena, comienzan a desarrollar acciones según sus programas de trabajo. La Dirección de Gestión del Riesgo entrega lineamientos a Comités Regionales y Filiales para continuar con el monitoreo y estar preparados ante la necesidad de ayuda de la comunidad y/o instituciones que combaten el fuego. La Dirección de Salud entrega recomendaciones referentes a los golpes de calor y primeros auxilios ante estas emergencias. La Dirección de comunicaciones divulga en redes sociales de la SN infografías y videos educativos respecto a los golpes de calor, kit de emergencias y qué hacer en caso de humo e incendios forestales.


El Equipo de Acción Anticipatoria de Cruz Roja chilena realizó Reporte Meteorológico RP-07 (Ver en anexo) que incluye información meteorológica para ser compartida con los Comités Regionales y Filiales afectadas por la amenaza de calor de estos días.


El Equipo de Gestión de la Información (IM) de Cruz Roja chilena realiza monitoreo de fuentes oficiales y secundarias para mantener información en tiempo real de las condiciones climáticas de distintos puntos del país. Se preparan documentos y formularios para realizar los respectivos reportes ante una emergencia y ser compartidos con Comités Regionales y Filiales.

Voluntarios de Comités Regionales y filiales preparan su material de ayuda ante posibles despliegues en sus comunas. Activan contactos con instituciones involucradas en emergencias para coordinaciones y apoyos ante posibles incendios forestales.


ACCIONES DE CRUZ ROJA CHILENA DURANTE LA EMERGENCIA

Al declararse la alerta roja por parte de SENAPRED Cruz Roja Chilena comienza a desplegar sus recursos en ayuda de los lugares más afectados.

Las distintas Direcciones Nacionales de Cruz Roja Chilena, bajo el apoyo y coordinación de Presidencia y Dirección Ejecutiva, comienzan a desarrollar acciones según sus programas de trabajo. La Dirección de Gestión del Riesgo toma contacto directo con Comités Regionales y Filiales para evaluar la situación de los voluntarios y zonas afectadas. La Dirección de Salud monitorea la situación y dispone de su equipo y apoyo a las zonas afectadas. La Dirección de comunicaciones divulga en redes sociales de la SN infografías para reforzar el uso de kit de emergencia y qué hacer ante evacuaciones por incendios forestales. Durante la noche del viernes 2 de febrero se realiza reunión de mesa técnica para coordinar trabajos con la Región de Valparaíso


El Equipo de Acción Anticipatoria de Cruz Roja Chilena realiza monitoreo de condiciones climáticas para este fin de semana, lo cuál puede generar que los incendios forestales continúen estos días en especial para el sábado 3 de febrero se esperan condiciones extremas en sectores ya afectados.

 

El Equipo de Gestión de la Información (IM) de Cruz Roja Chilena realiza revisión de información de la emergencia, consolidando datos y reportes de SENAPRED, CONAF, Bomberos, CONAF, Carabineros, gobierno, medios de comunicaciones, redes sociales y contactos en la zona. Se recibe la información a través de formulario en KoBo respecto a la situación y acciones de Filiales. Se consolida información en BIE para ser compartido con el fin de entregar esta información a la SN para que se tomen las decisiones correspondientes para la gestión de la emergencia y apoyo al voluntariado en terreno. 

 

Voluntarios de Comités Regionales y Filiales realizan monitoreo de sectores afectados y se despliegan según necesidades locales.

 

  • Comité Regional Valparaíso: Monitoreo de la emergencia, contacto con Direcciones Nacionales y equipos de apoyo para entrega de información y reportes. Principales necesidades: Mascarillas, agua, guantes, suero, vendajes, gasas, apósitos, guantes de trabajo.



  • Filial Limache: Se puso en contacto con las filiales mencionadas en este mismo informe para trabajar en conjunto y apoyarse mutuamente, además de que voluntarios se trasladaron a filial de villa alemana para brindar mayor apoyo así mismo limache se puso en coordinación con la oficina de emergencia a la espera de actuar. 7 voluntarios. Se encuentran trabajando en quebrada alvarado, realizando 82 atenciones hasta el momento: 66 aseos oculares, 11 curaciones, 5 CSV, 82 atenciones de APS

  • Filial Viña del Mar: Se mantiene activa la filial de viña del mar a la espera de su voluntariado, la filial se mantiene abierta mientras que está en constante alerta por respuesta. Se encuentran en constante monitoreo y activación de la Filial. Por parte de Gestión de Riesgo se realiza acuartelamiento en la Filial donde un voluntario queda en puesto realizando comunicación con voluntarios remotos, y otros 4 asisten a albergues para apoyar en labores de PAP, curaciones y acciones en general. Voluntarios remotos organizan la participación de los demás voluntarios que asistieron a la Filial al día siguiente. Bienestar Social 2 voluntarios se comunican con todos los voluntarios de la Filial para saber sobre su bienestar y sus familias.12 voluntarios.

  • Filial Quillota: Se puso en contacto con las filiales mencionadas en este mismo informe para trabajar en conjunto y apoyarse mutuamente.

  • Filial Olmué: Se puso en contacto con las filiales mencionadas en este mismo informe para trabajar en conjunto y apoyarse mutuamente.

  • Filial Villa Alemana: Se puso en contacto con las filiales mencionadas en este mismo informe para trabajar en conjunto y apoyarse mutuamente, además de que la filial se activó a la espera de voluntarios. 5 voluntarios. Se mantiene monitoreo remoto. información por parte de telecomunicaciones de recomendaciones por la presencia de humo, incendios forestales antes, durante y después a través de redes sociales. Contacto con la Municipalidad para tomar medidas en conjunto. Voluntarios activos en Filial en espera de confirmación para tomar acciones por parte de la Filial.



Imágenes de trabajo realizado por Filiales y Comité Regional Valparaíso:






Comité Regional O’Higgins: Monitoreo de la emergencia, contacto con Direcciones Nacionales y equipos de apoyo

results.summary:
Basados en el reporte del Servicio Meteorológico de Chile, desde el martes 30 de enero al sábado 4 de febrero se presenta una alerta por calor extremo. La alerta vigente de Meteorología considera a las siguientes zonas:

 

Región de Coquimbo en la cordillera costa, precordillera y valles precordilleranos con hasta 36°C.

Región de Valparaíso en el litoral, cordillera costa, precordillera y valles precordilleranos con hasta 39°C.

Región Metropolitana en la cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 38°C.

Región de O’Higgins en el litoral, cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 37°C.

Región del Maule en el litoral, cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 38°C.

Región del Ñuble en la cordillera costa, valle y precordillera con hasta 37°C.

 

Durante la semana se presentaron distintos focos de incendios forestales pero actualmente los que presentan mayor intensidad y de características extremas son los incendios que comenzaron el 31 de enero en la comuna La Estrella, Región de O’Higgins el cual sigue activo con más de 2.500 hectáreas. Además, en la Región de Valparaíso durante el 2 de febrero se iniciaron distintos focos de incendio en las comunas de Villa Alemana, Quilpué y Viña del Mar, los cuales han destruido viviendas e infraestructura crítica como antenas de comunicaciones, cortes de carreteras, entre otros. En la Región del Maule se presentan focos activos, los con mayor intensidad son los que se encuentran las comunas de Pencahue y Curepto con cerca de 1.000 hectáreas quemadas.

 

Al día Sábado 03 de febrero, 17:30 hrs, se declaran 45.812 hectáreas afectadas por Incendios Forestales, siendo la región de Valparaíso la más compleja debido a la gran cantidad de zonas urbanas expuestas, en total esta región tiene 12.939 hectáreas afectadas.

Zonas más relevantes con incendios forestales

 

Región de Valparaíso:

 

 

Focos más relevantes con incendios forestales:

 



Información extraída de fuentes oficiales, en este caso página web de SENAPRED. Los números pueden ser mayores en estos momentos pero no serán actualizados hasta confirmación y publicación en esta fuente oficial.








02 de febrero de 2024

 

En el caso de la Región de Valparaíso, en donde se encuentra la mayor afectación se tiene lo siguiente:

 

Han sido 23 las zonas evacuadas en tres comunas:

 

  • Viña del Mar: Achupallas, Canal Beagle, El Olivar, Jardín Botánico, Villa Arauco, Villa Hermosa, Villa Independencia, Villa Rucán y Reñaca Alto.

  • Quilpué: Canal Chacao, Los Pinos, Colinas de Oro, Teniente Serrano, Calichero, Pompeya, Canal Chacao, Los Lunes, Villa Olímpica y Población Argentina.

  • Villa Alemana: Patagual, Lo Hidalgo, Quebrada Escobares y Fundo el Rincón.

  • En esa misma línea, se solicitó a los conductores que transitan hacia Valparaíso postergar su viaje y no transitar hacia la costa para facilitar el apoyo de los equipos de emergencia de la RM que se dirigen a la región.



03 de febrero de 2024

 

Luego de la realización del COGRID nacional, a las 3:00 horas del sábado 3 de febrero la Ministra del Interior Carolina Toha menciona la siguiente información:

 

La autoridad de Gobierno mencionó que "hemos tenido una evolución de los incendios que ha tocado zonas con mucha presencia de áreas urbanas, de viviendas, de personas con afectaciones que todavía no podemos dimensionar".

 

Agregó que se trata de una situación, "compleja, preocupante y que requiere un despliegue muy intenso y medidas a la altura de la gravedad que se vive en la región".

 

De igual forma, explicó que "hay dos incendios principales que están afectando en Valparaíso, uno en la comuna de Viña del Mar y otro en la comuna de Quilpué".

 

Ante esto, en Quilpué, "es un incendio de 850 hectáreas y - hasta ahora- sabemos de 100 viviendas afectadas". Y en la comuna de Viña del Mar, "la afectación es mucho mayor (...) no tenemos una medida de las viviendas afectadas, se estima que deben ser alrededor de mil, no tenemos números confirmados de víctimas. Algunos reportes hablan de 10 personas, otros de 16 y vamos a tener un número consolidado el día de mañana".






Asimismo, Tohá informó que debido al estado de excepción en Valparaíso, se establece toque de queda entre las 8:00 y 12:00 horas para las siguientes comunas: 

 

  • Limache.

  • Villa Alemana.

  • Quilpué.

  • Viña del Mar.

 

La ministra aclaró que el toque de queda, "tiene por objeto que en esos lugares los traslados que se hagan sean solamente ligados a los servicios de emergencias y potenciales evacuaciones".

 

  • 3 Cesfam, 1 SAPU y 3 hogares de ancianos afectados por los IF.

 

Alrededor de las 12:15 hrs se hace la actualización del Resumen Nacional de IF.

 

Los albergues que se encuentran habilitados son los siguientes:

 

  • Escuela Manuel Montt, comuna de Villa Alemana (capacidad 100 personas).

  • Escuela República de Colombia, comuna de Viña del Mar (capacidad de 120 personas).

  • Colegio Humberto Vilches, comuna de Viña del Mar (capacidad de 100 personas).

  • Colegio Fernando Durán, comuna de Quilpué (capacidad de 50 personas).

  • Liceo Ivet Vergara, comuna de Quilpué (capacidad de 166 personas).

  • Escuela Concón Nacional, comuna de Concón (capacidad de 30 personas).
